history.review_excerpt: He's still mostly solo, and managed to get even more cute and unique monsters, but they're leveling up and he's getting more comfortable. The Olive Treant from volume 3 has hatched and she is an interesting addition to the team. Thanks to that, the forums that I missed in book 3, because no one was doing the forums because of the events, are back and I am loving them I'm not sure why, unless it's because we can see how others are doing and how Yuto is regarded and other world-building info. I hope that somehow, even though I don't really understand the time-flow of it and know that he has to run out of summer vacation at some point, I hope it will go on for several more volumes.
history.review_full:
It's nice to see Yuto (Silver-haired) getting out and doing with his fellow gamers. He's still mostly solo, and managed to get even more cute and unique monsters, but they're leveling up and he's getting more comfortable. The Olive Treant from volume 3 has hatched and she is an interesting addition to the team. Yuto and the crew have also moved on to a new area (hence the new monsters and more farming and crafting). Thanks to that, the forums that I missed in book 3, because no one was doing the forums because of the events, are back and I am loving them I'm not sure why, unless it's because we can see how others are doing and how Yuto is regarded and other world-building info. And Yuto got to meet BunBun :D

I'm loving this series. I hope that somehow, even though I don't really understand the time-flow of it and know that he has to run out of summer vacation at some point, I hope it will go on for several more volumes.
history.review_title: Silver-haired still doing his own thing with still more cute monsters

product.title: A Late-Start Tamer’s Laid-Back Life: Volume 4

history.review_excerpt:
It's a pretty quick read, and a pretty good story.

The plot's interesting, though it's a little surprising how easily the unsuitable people are eliminated. I think I only actually liked a couple of the characters; however I don't think we were necessarily meant to as these are fairly normal people (for the most part) dealing with an extreme and abnormal situation. Each town is allowed so many "bad" actions before it is "reset" aka destroyed. Absolute power corrupts absolutely, but doing something about it is hard with the close surveillance. The end of the book felt a bit like a cliff-hanger to me, but I am hoping the author is able to publish book 2 soon.
history.review_full:
I picked up ReSet at the request of a friend as the story sounded rather like the YA dystopian novels of my teens. I started reading it before I went to bed and finished it before I went to sleep. It's a pretty quick read, and a pretty good story.

The plot's interesting, though it's a little surprising how easily the unsuitable people are eliminated. I think I only actually liked a couple of the characters; however I don't think we were necessarily meant to as these are fairly normal people (for the most part) dealing with an extreme and abnormal situation. The fellow in charge, Greyson Jeffers, who made this situation happen, keeps a close eye on the people he allows to form towns with the help of microchips implanted in them. Each town is allowed so many "bad" actions before it is "reset" aka destroyed. Absolute power corrupts absolutely, but doing something about it is hard with the close surveillance. The end of the book felt a bit like a cliff-hanger to me, but I am hoping the author is able to publish book 2 soon.
history.review_title: First new book that isn't a light novel to draw me into a one-night-read in a long time

product.title: ReSet: Be Good Your Life Depends On It

history.review_excerpt:
I've read all 5 of the Casual Farming novels that are currently out, though this is the first one I've actually written a review on. Old friends have new roles, new faces have joined the town so he's not the newest guy, and he has thoroughly settled in. I really enjoyed this.

I am still, after 5 books, unsure of what to make of the time system in this universe. I'm happy we don't have Jason's wife puking all day every day for 7 months, but getting through the pregnancy in one season is a little strange. It works though, kind of like the seasons changing at midnight exactly on the last day of the season.

Anyway, I'm looking forward to book 6, whenever they get it published.
history.review_full:
I've read all 5 of the Casual Farming novels that are currently out, though this is the first one I've actually written a review on. We've followed Jason from his arrival in Summer Shandy to his marriage and first child. Old friends have new roles, new faces have joined the town so he's not the newest guy, and he has thoroughly settled in. I really enjoyed this.

I am still, after 5 books, unsure of what to make of the time system in this universe. I'm happy we don't have Jason's wife puking all day every day for 7 months, but getting through the pregnancy in one season is a little strange. It works though, kind of like the seasons changing at midnight exactly on the last day of the season.

Anyway, I'm looking forward to book 6, whenever they get it published. :)
history.review_title: This has been a good series

heldout.review_excerpt:
This was the first non-light novel/non-manga I’ve managed to focus on all the way through in the last month. I liked the characters, though I was surprised some of the named ones in the first chapter didn’t show up again. The plot was pretty good, and I liked the setup for the second book.

That said, I guess I’m out of practice as there were several blips to get past the ‘relations’ going on and I think I’ve heard more about large roosters, tight cats, and unfindable places than I have in the last year… or two… LOL

Definitely looking forward to book 2 with Tate and Emily and hoping the 2 male stupid donkeys will get their comeuppance in there as well.

history.review_excerpt:
The conversations, thinking and logic of the prehistoric cave characters are jarringly impossible.

The entire prehistoric Book one could just as well be dated 2020. Aside from English usage as a necessity, the characters being so in touch with their emotions & feelings, along with outstanding medical knowledge of inner organs just ruins any credibility of this having taken place. The absolute worst time travel book I have ever read.

And to believe the average musical pipe playing cave woman turns into a 2006 popstar within a month of landing is beyond stupid. I did finish the book, hoping Book 2 would improve.
history.review_full:
Skipping past the sappy romance, the book has an absolutely fatal flaw in re: to time travel. The story takes place 7000 plus years ago. The conversations, thinking and logic of the prehistoric cave characters are jarringly impossible.

The entire prehistoric Book one could just as well be dated 2020. Aside from English usage as a necessity, the characters being so in touch with their emotions & feelings, along with outstanding medical knowledge of inner organs just ruins any credibility of this having taken place. The absolute worst time travel book I have ever read.

And to believe the average musical pipe playing cave woman turns into a 2006 popstar within a month of landing is beyond stupid. I did finish the book, hoping Book 2 would improve. It didn't.

history.review_excerpt:
The Accident of Color is a masterful undertaking that provides background on how race took place in America. The book covers the edentured bondsman system, chattel slavery, then progresses to explain how colorism began as a means to separate the classes and keep a workforce of “Slaves for life.”

There are many interesting historical moments and sadly many bad ones. The inclusion of laws put on the books to prevent race mixing, stifle economic progress, and the violent tactics used to regain political control are also noted. This is a fascinating read full of facts and sources to further an understanding of racism in America.
history.review_full:
The Accident of Color is a masterful undertaking that provides background on how race took place in America. The book covers the edentured bondsman system, chattel slavery, then progresses to explain how colorism began as a means to separate the classes and keep a workforce of “Slaves for life.”

There are many interesting historical moments and sadly many bad ones. I enjoyed learning more about the creole culture and Louisiana history. The inclusion of laws put on the books to prevent race mixing, stifle economic progress, and the violent tactics used to regain political control are also noted. This is a fascinating read full of facts and sources to further an understanding of racism in America.
history.review_title: Interesting historical view of American race and racism

history.review_excerpt:
I like the idea of writing away the stress and fear and think the added gems of how to organize what we want to keep.

You will get the basics of how to sort, sell, shred, take pictures, and declutter but you will get so much more. The tips will keep you progressing.
A bonus thought was if you haven't used an item in three months, it doesn't have to go if you know you will use it within the next three months. If you suffer from holding onto too much stuff, this book will help you evaluate your life to create a more streamlined space.

I must say, I'm still impressed that this book had me smiling and anticipating how to make simple changes to improve my clutter, mood, physical health, and mental peace. This is an excellent book that I will recommend to my friends and family.
history.review_full:
I was pleasantly shocked at how much this book made me smile. Yes, an uncluttering book that makes learning to conquer your clutter, mental, physical, and emotional, fun and painless. The first two sections are dedicated to non-physical clutter and include exercises to work through our fear, anger, and other mental spaces that prevent growth.

The physical clutter issues are dealt with in section three. This section offers a lot of ways to entice the reader to make changes, i.e., get a clitter biddy, take before and after pictures, and how to put items into use, donate, toss, or sell. I like the idea of writing away the stress and fear and think the added gems of how to organize what we want to keep.

You will get the basics of how to sort, sell, shred, take pictures, and declutter but you will get so much more. The tips will keep you progressing.
A bonus thought was if you haven't used an item in three months, it doesn't have to go if you know you will use it within the next three months. This book suggests taking time, rewarding the small steps, and embracing achievements. If you suffer from holding onto too much stuff, this book will help you evaluate your life to create a more streamlined space.

I must say, I'm still impressed that this book had me smiling and anticipating how to make simple changes to improve my clutter, mood, physical health, and mental peace. This is an excellent book that I will recommend to my friends and family.
history.review_title: Bravo for A fresh multilayer approach to reduce clutter.

history.review_excerpt:
Most memoirs like this are callous, messy, and often offensive, and I don't make it halfway through.

However, the memoir covers so much hurt, self-harm, abuse, eating disorders, prostitution, drug use and selling, prison time, and many spirals that it could be a movie. I didn't understand many of her choices, and most people may not understand them, but what she does is shows how a privileged life can go terribly wrong. This is honesty, integrity, and love in its most complicated form.

Corrections in Ink may not be a book for you, but her life has helped many in our prison systems be treated as humans.
history.review_full:
Corrections in ink is a memoir of a life that hits bottom and bounces back, only to fall again. This author reached into pits of mess that I had never imagined. Most memoirs like this are callous, messy, and often offensive, and I don't make it halfway through.

However, the memoir covers so much hurt, self-harm, abuse, eating disorders, prostitution, drug use and selling, prison time, and many spirals that it could be a movie. The gift of this story is the writer. She is a brilliant storyteller and uses her troubles as a sword to help others end their suffering and get a chance at life and redemption.

The story is sad and emotional. I didn't understand many of her choices, and most people may not understand them, but what she does is shows how a privileged life can go terribly wrong. Then she shows how she put the pieces back together. This is honesty, integrity, and love in its most complicated form.

Corrections in Ink may not be a book for you, but her life has helped many in our prison systems be treated as humans. If you see nothing else, I hope you see that gift on her pages.
history.review_title: A brilliant look at a fall from privilege and a path to redemption

product.title: Corrections in Ink: A Memoir

history.review_excerpt:
The two of them make a great team, and they spend the day creating memories, mischief, and fun.

This is a wholesome story with good pacing and great details. The characters, historical era, and storyline were a pleasant change from my usual reading. It reminded me of the feeling I get from the Jimmy Stewart movie ending of It's a Wonderful Life.

If you want fast pacing, modern flings, or tragedy, this is not the book for you. If you need a break, love a slower time in history and a little mystery, you will enjoy The Mystery of Mary enjoyable. I recommend taking the three hours to read or listen to the audiobook.
history.review_full:
The Mystery of Mary is a fabulous story of a sweet lady looking for a chance to be free and self-supporting. She is running in search of a place of safety when she meets a handsome stranger. The two of them make a great team, and they spend the day creating memories, mischief, and fun.

This is a wholesome story with good pacing and great details. The characters, historical era, and storyline were a pleasant change from my usual reading. The book is short and delivers a sweet ending. It reminded me of the feeling I get from the Jimmy Stewart movie ending of It's a Wonderful Life.

If you want fast pacing, modern flings, or tragedy, this is not the book for you. If you need a break, love a slower time in history and a little mystery, you will enjoy The Mystery of Mary enjoyable. I recommend taking the three hours to read or listen to the audiobook.
history.review_title: Boy and girl, unite and build a world

product.title: The Mystery of Mary

heldout.review_excerpt:
This book will help you see life through the innocent eyes of a struggling child who grows up to be a brilliant writer.

There are moments when I wanted to shake the adults in her life.. People eho don't like children and choose to take them in for money shouldn't be called parents.

Then the racist ballet instructor who didn't want a little black girl dancer seen and neighbor parents isolating loving children shows that growing into adulthood doesn't equal intelligence.

There were many missed opportunities to shower children with love and so many people failed her and her sister. Ishook my head, not in disbelief but in fatigue at the repetition of foolishness in society.~~ We must do better.
heldout.review_full:
Ordinary hazards is a lyrical telling of a childhood spent in the foster system, and the tragedies she experiences. There are vivid memories, stories of childhood dreams, and fears. There are profoundly moving and reflective moments that put you inside her nightmare.

I appreciate her honesty, delicate memories, and the way she shares the loss felt during the forced seperation from her sister. This book will help you see life through the innocent eyes of a struggling child who grows up to be a brilliant writer.

There are moments when I wanted to shake the adults in her life.. The grandmother who wouldn't be bothered. The father who refused to try raising girls, and some of the mean foster/caregivers. People eho don't like children and choose to take them in for money shouldn't be called parents.

Then the racist ballet instructor who didn't want a little black girl dancer seen and neighbor parents isolating loving children shows that growing into adulthood doesn't equal intelligence.

There were many missed opportunities to shower children with love and so many people failed her and her sister. Ishook my head, not in disbelief but in fatigue at the repetition of foolishness in society.~~ We must do better.
heldout.review_title: An honest look at the foster system and tough childhood

This book is an excellent example of why you shouldn't judge by a cover. I mistakenly thought this was a cheesy romance novel. It's not. It's really about political turmoil, economic woes, social upheaval and the interconnectivity between them. There's also a sprinkle of romance for fun. You can feel the author's love of travel by the meticulous attention to location details. This book is perfect to read on a long trip or if you enjoy traveling vicariously via reading. Give this book a fair chance before judging.

Thanks so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope it makes your decision a little easier.

history.review_excerpt: If you have a condition that is easily treated with a prescription or routine surgery, you probably have no idea of the rampant amount of corruption and plain out incompetence that are almost commonplace. I was nearly killed by a doctor who gave me a prescription that could have had a fatal interaction with something I was previously prescribed, even though I had brought a folder with all of my medical details. I am so sorry for everything the author had to experience, especially the loss of her father. Sometimes things happen not just "to" us, but "for" us. As the saying goes, "Turn your mess into your message." This book is a stellar example of doing so.
history.review_full: I really wanted to read this book after scanning the synopsis. I have so much in common with the author. I have also been through a harrowing experience with the medical community. If you have a condition that is easily treated with a prescription or routine surgery, you probably have no idea of the rampant amount of corruption and plain out incompetence that are almost commonplace. I was nearly killed by a doctor who gave me a prescription that could have had a fatal interaction with something I was previously prescribed, even though I had brought a folder with all of my medical details. I think this book is an important read for anyone who has experienced gaslighting by a doctor. Trust your intuition! You know your body best. Find a doctor who will actually listen to you and treat you like a human, not just a set of symptoms. Learn as much as you can in order to heal yourself. I, like the author, have often wondered why doctors never tell you about natural remedies and alternative therapies. I am so sorry for everything the author had to experience, especially the loss of her father. Sometimes things happen not just "to" us, but "for" us. Hold on to the light of hope and let it guide you forward. As the saying goes, "Turn your mess into your message." This book is a stellar example of doing so. I wish the author well on her journey and look forward to reading the follow-up book.

product.title: Turning Pain Into Strength: I made pain my driving force.

heldout.review_excerpt:
I have a 4-year-old niece who is absolutely obsessed with nature. I thought this would be a good fit for her. The little butterfly wants to spread her wings and make the world stand up and notice her beauty. People notice and appreciate when you spread love and joy. Staying true to who you are and helping others bloom is more important than trying to gain attention.

I definitely wasn't expecting such a thoughtful lesson from a children's book. I'd love to see this book turned into a children's TV program. I HIGHLY recommend this book.

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided helps make your decision a little easier.
heldout.review_full:
I have a 4-year-old niece who is absolutely obsessed with nature. I thought this would be a good fit for her. I preview all the books I send as I'm concerned about messaging. This is a children's book that also speaks to adults. The little butterfly wants to spread her wings and make the world stand up and notice her beauty. She gets a friendly reminder that beauty is more than skin (or wing) deep. People notice and appreciate when you spread love and joy. A warm smile from a stranger can make all the difference in someone's day. Staying true to who you are and helping others bloom is more important than trying to gain attention.

I definitely wasn't expecting such a thoughtful lesson from a children's book. I hope this book is the first in a series from this author. I think she has real talent and something important to say. I'd love to see this book turned into a children's TV program. I HIGHLY recommend this book.

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided helps make your decision a little easier.

The Ocean at the end of the Land is listed as fantasy. It is but not what you think. It's the story of a little boy and a traumatic event that changed who he will grow to be....with Neil's magic woven in.
It isn't a hard read...It can take a day. There are spots you get lost but I think that is the point. It's a beautiful way to spend an afternoon.

history.review_excerpt: I listened to the audio version. It was an interesting story with a sense of mystery re letters written by a wife while she was dying of cancer. She wrote many letters to her husband and he did not know who was delivering them after his wife died. He suspected his wife had had an affair in her past with a man she had known but had never told her husband who he was. By the time he receives all the letters, and does some research on his own, the surprise is not at all what he expected.

product.title: Flight to the Horizon

history.review_excerpt: Autumn Swan is a 25ish year old on a fast track to making her life all she wants it to be. Her only bouts of stability were the summer months where she lived with her grandmother and her cousin Becki from age six to age 15ish. Out of nowhere she is left custody of her cousin's 12 year old daughter, Gabe, a child she didn't know about from a cousin she hasn't communicated with in over 10-ish years. Gabe wants nothing to do with this complete stranger and when Autumn takes her back to live with her she longs to return to her home and the neighbor, Catherine, the 35 year old war vet suffering from PTSD. This story had more surprises you usually see in a romance and will make a SUPER selection for a book club.
history.review_full: Autumn Swan is a 25ish year old on a fast track to making her life all she wants it to be. Living in Decatur Georgia she has made it on her own her whole life. Her parents are deadheads who had no time for her. Her only bouts of stability were the summer months where she lived with her grandmother and her cousin Becki from age six to age 15ish. Out of nowhere she is left custody of her cousin's 12 year old daughter, Gabe, a child she didn't know about from a cousin she hasn't communicated with in over 10-ish years. Gabe wants nothing to do with this complete stranger and when Autumn takes her back to live with her she longs to return to her home and the neighbor, Catherine, the 35 year old war vet suffering from PTSD. This story had more surprises you usually see in a romance and will make a SUPER selection for a book club.
history.review_title: A lot of drama packed into this romance

product.title: Ordinary is Perfect

history.review_excerpt: Charlie and Emma are 5 years out of college. Charlie blew off her family and her girlfriend (Emma of 8 years) when she graduated with her business degree and left for a life in NYC. Chapter 1 shows her moving in to her parents basement. I love that you get to see Charlie's actions through their eyes. Emma has turned her culinary degree into something meaningful and is a terrific person. So much happens in this book I wish I had a book club to talk with others about it. The author throws you a number of surprises. There are so many delicious things in this books - my favorite may be Emma and the cherry pie. I am still amazed at the ending.
history.review_full: Charlie and Emma are 5 years out of college. Charlie blew off her family and her girlfriend (Emma of 8 years) when she graduated with her business degree and left for a life in NYC. Chapter 1 shows her moving in to her parents basement. This is a super story! I loved Charlie's parents, her sister and her friends. I love that you get to see Charlie's actions through their eyes. Emma has turned her culinary degree into something meaningful and is a terrific person. So much happens in this book I wish I had a book club to talk with others about it. The author throws you a number of surprises. There are so many delicious things in this books - my favorite may be Emma and the cherry pie. I am still amazed at the ending.
history.review_title: Fabulous story set in small town Vermont

product.title: Flavor of the Month

history.review_excerpt: I love all the backstory we get on Kat and Wendy. Kat had more drama in her 41 years then anyone I know personally. I loved the Los Angeles setting, I know the city well and feel like I was back there. I thought Kat and Wendy's relationship was very real and true to life. I loved learning about Wendy's career and felt she and Kat were both terrific people. Kat's 17 year old son was so well written he came off as a real person. This is a substantial story stretching back decades. The dialogue was convincing and the pacing kept me turning pages well past midnight.
history.review_full: I love all the backstory we get on Kat and Wendy. Kat had more drama in her 41 years then anyone I know personally. I loved learning about Wendy's career and felt she and Kat were both terrific people. Kat's 17 year old son was so well written he came off as a real person. This is a substantial story stretching back decades. The dialogue was convincing and the pacing kept me turning pages well past midnight.

product.title: Kat's Nine LIves

heldout.review_excerpt: Ana is raised on the estate of a wealthy business man. Her mother Carmen is a maid working for George Prescott. Ana and George's daughter were secret friends since Ana was 7 years old. Secret, because George is your typical GOP racist and only allows his daughter to associate with with his peers and their children. They fell in love, George finds out and finds a way to severe the relationship. George's daughter does the unthinkable and allows Ana to think the worst of her 'for her own good'. 15 years later as the book opens George is 6 feet under and the roller-coaster of a story takes off!

history.review_excerpt: I read this series many years ago... it is about a cave woman and it chronicles her life. Jean  Auel is a very talented writer and story teller... the first two of the series are clearly the best... the rest get a little too much into the details of things... but are still worth reading. It's nice to have the whole series so you just fall right into the next one. If you like a saga type story, I think you'll like this. Normally I like renaissance period/history pieces.. and this is clearly a lot earlier (cavemen)... but stilll.. a saga.

I love true crime but i must admit, I can be very impatient and in many true crime books I read, I find certain parts drag on and on so I skip over them. That didn't happen once with this book. I read it from cover to cover, nonstop. Its a great read. I wonder if Angelina ever kicks herself for opening her mouth after Frank died? Had she kept her mouth shut, she wouldn't have been caught. Not as bright as you think you are, are you Angelina?

Rest peacefully, Frank

product.title: A Perfect Stranger: An absolutely gripping psychological thriller that will have you hooked

history.review_excerpt:
Who knows how many more #1 songs he would have had had he not passed away 30+ years ago. From growing up as the baby in the Gibb family, throughout childhood/teen years, up until his death at the too young age of 30, this book covers it all. Its almost hard to fathom someone who was so talented, VERY well liked and gorgeous could have such low self -esteem. Drug/alcohol addiction, a desire to be the best, wanting (desperately, at times) to be a member of the Bee Gees, losing the love of his life, Victoria Principal, a failed marriage, not having a relationship with his young daughter... But its also nice to read about Andy's incredible talent and especially what an incredibly kind, well-liked man he was.

The book was a fast read for me.
history.review_full:
Oh, Andy. He left us far too soon. Who knows how many more #1 songs he would have had had he not passed away 30+ years ago. If he were still alive, I think he'd make an excellent judge on reality talent- competition shows that currently air. Anyway...this an excellent biography that covers Andy's all -too short life. From growing up as the baby in the Gibb family, throughout childhood/teen years, up until his death at the too young age of 30, this book covers it all. Its almost hard to fathom someone who was so talented, VERY well liked and gorgeous could have such low self -esteem. And demons...oh, the demons. Drug/alcohol addiction, a desire to be the best, wanting (desperately, at times) to be a member of the Bee Gees, losing the love of his life, Victoria Principal, a failed marriage, not having a relationship with his young daughter... ALL of this is addressed in the book. I must tell you, there will be moments in this book that might make you quite sad. I sure was. But its also nice to read about Andy's incredible talent and especially what an incredibly kind, well-liked man he was.

The book was a fast read for me. I enjoyed every page of it.
history.review_title: An Excellent Look at Andy's All-Too Short Life

product.title: Arrow Through the Heart: The Biography of Andy Gibb

history.review_excerpt:
I finally got around to reading it and I agree with the hype it was so fun and cute!

I loved April’s and Jackson’s tension and bickering almost as much as I loved their “pretend” flirting and accidental moments of almost love!

“Hey, April, calling for that raincheck?” “Yes. Because it could use some work.” April dropped her head against the wall in frustration. Then immediately pulled it back because that was gross. Please save me.”

Jackson is so sweet and attentive! ❤️

‘Heaven help her—now the man was sitting atop a horse holding pie. Blackberry?” “Done.” And he reached across the space between them to hand her one of the boxes.
history.review_full:
I finally got around to reading it and I agree with the hype it was so fun and cute!

I loved April’s and Jackson’s tension and bickering almost as much as I loved their “pretend” flirting and accidental moments of almost love!

“Hey, April, calling for that raincheck?” “Yes. Women’s bathroom. Now.” “Uh… is that your way of talking dirty to me? Because it could use some work.” April dropped her head against the wall in frustration. Then immediately pulled it back because that was gross. “Definitely not. Please save me.”

Jackson is so sweet and attentive! He always seems to know exactly what April needs and is always looking out for her. It is adorable! ❤️

‘Heaven help her—now the man was sitting atop a horse holding pie. Sexy didn’t even cover it. “Um. Blackberry?” “Done.” And he reached across the space between them to hand her one of the boxes. In it sat a delicious-looking blackberry pie. It was even a little warm still. “Okay, how did you just happen to have my favorite pie?” He shrugged. “Lucky guess.”’

If you haven’t read this book, DO IT! It will definitely make you want to visit Hawai’i!
history.review_title: It’ll make you want to visit Hawai’i!

product.title: Pretending At Love: A Sweet Romantic Comedy (Greenbank Romances Book 2)

history.review_excerpt:
Romi wants to keep running the business in honor of her grandparents hard work.

Their passion and raw chemistry was swoony and adorable.

I love romances and true love stories but this was almost a little too much. Lucas is a little cheesy.

I liked all the fun little events they did through the week of the wedding, the plane scene was exciting and sounded so fun!

If you like lovey-dovey romances this is a cute easy read!

I reviewed a free copy of this book and voluntarily offer my review.
history.review_full:
This is a love at first sight story (technically before they even met).

Romi is a powerful business woman who runs the family lakeside retreat and Lucas is the step-son of a billionaire real estate tycoon who wants to buy the retreat and turn it into rich luxury housing.

Lucas is stuck trying to keep his job and is being controlled by his stepfather to do his bidding. Romi wants to keep running the business in honor of her grandparents hard work.

Their passion and raw chemistry was swoony and adorable.

I love romances and true love stories but this was almost a little too much. Lucas is a little cheesy.

I liked all the fun little events they did through the week of the wedding, the plane scene was exciting and sounded so fun!

If you like lovey-dovey romances this is a cute easy read!

I reviewed a free copy of this book and voluntarily offer my review.

product.title: Romi and the Best Man: A Lake Sterling Small Town Sweet Romance (Lake Sterling Sweet Romance)

heldout.review_excerpt:
They try to put their hurt feelings behind them and work past Hudson’s toxic disapproving parents so that they can civically make this event a success.

Abi was very detailed in her writing about Lex’s and Hudson’s emotions. I laugh at her response and shake my head.’

Not only did I like watching Lex and Hudson’s relationship grow and transform but I loved other relationships around them as well. Tristan and Hudson’s brotherly bond was so heartwarming too, even if they didn’t see each other or talk very often over the past few years they still see each other as confidants and best friends. Her’s and Lex’s relationship is so sassy but loving it was adorable!

I was given a free ARC of this book, but the thoughts are my own.
heldout.review_full:
It’s a cute second-chance romance, after 4 years Lex comes face to face with her ex, Hudson, as they have to plan their best friend’s joint bachelor and bachelorette party. They try to put their hurt feelings behind them and work past Hudson’s toxic disapproving parents so that they can civically make this event a success.

Abi was very detailed in her writing about Lex’s and Hudson’s emotions. We got an in depth look of exactly what they were going through and how they were trying to work through their feelings.

‘“Alexa, turn off these feelings,” I call out in the studio and drop my head against the wooden barre in the dance room. “I can’t find a device under the name These Feelings,” Alexa responds like the trained AI she is, but even she can’t find a solution to the mess in my head. Considering we have the same name, it’s like I’m talking to myself. I laugh at her response and shake my head.’

Not only did I like watching Lex and Hudson’s relationship grow and transform but I loved other relationships around them as well. I loved Ellie, Hope, and Lex’s friendship, constantly being there for one another. Tristan and Hudson’s brotherly bond was so heartwarming too, even if they didn’t see each other or talk very often over the past few years they still see each other as confidants and best friends. And I loved Abuela! Her’s and Lex’s relationship is so sassy but loving it was adorable!

I was given a free ARC of this book, but the thoughts are my own.

heldout.review_excerpt: Clueless is fun and cute with a compelling storyline, but I was disappointed that the overall feel is of a less mature writer. I’ve read other Broom stories, so I feel confident in saying this is not the same and may have been written years ago and just wasn’t published. The characters and basic story are compelling enough I’m intrigued to continue for now, but I do wish Broom would clean up the excessive narrative and juvenile dialog to make for a more interesting read.
heldout.review_full: Clueless is fun and cute with a compelling storyline, but I was disappointed that the overall feel is of a less mature writer. I’ve read other Broom stories, so I feel confident in saying this is not the same and may have been written years ago and just wasn’t published. The characters and basic story are compelling enough I’m intrigued to continue for now, but I do wish Broom would clean up the excessive narrative and juvenile dialog to make for a more interesting read.

product.title: Clueless (The Fairy Brew Book 1)

history.review_excerpt: This is a great book. The writing style is smooth with great flow and easy to follow. There are some quite hot and heavy scenes, but unlike other shifter books I've read, there is also a plot and the book does not rely solely on the sex scenes (which I found refreshing). The main character, Zane, has earned himself a spot quite high on my book boyfriend list! I recommend this to anyone who enjoys shifter/paranormal romance novels. It makes for the perfect book fix on a rainy Saturday afternoon. I hope there will be more, not only from this author, but also a continuation of this series and that the wait won't be too long!
history.review_full: This is a great book. The writing style is smooth with great flow and easy to follow. I literally finished this in under two hours. It is certainly a page turner. There are some quite hot and heavy scenes, but unlike other shifter books I've read, there is also a plot and the book does not rely solely on the sex scenes (which I found refreshing). The main character, Zane, has earned himself a spot quite high on my book boyfriend list! Holy wow! I recommend this to anyone who enjoys shifter/paranormal romance novels. It makes for the perfect book fix on a rainy Saturday afternoon. Two big thumbs up! I hope there will be more, not only from this author, but also a continuation of this series and that the wait won't be too long!

product.title: The Mountain Lion's Secretary: A BBW & Billionaire Shape Shifter Romance (Billionaire Security Shifters Book 1)

history.review_excerpt: This is a well written shifter story. It has a good plot (which some shifter books tend to lack - instead it seems as though the authors are in a race to get to the steamy parts and skip over the need for a decent plot). It is nicely thought out and written without many grammatical errors.. kudos to the editor! Given its length, lack of errors and interesting story-line, it was a quick and satisfying read and I look forward to future books in this series.

history.review_excerpt: Answers to questions I'd had since book 1 were answered, as well as a couple from book 2. The story line flowed seamlessly from the closing in book 2 to the beginning of book 3 just as flawlessly as the transition from book 1 to book 2. In fear of giving spoilers for those who have yet to read this series and are here to read reviews to see if it is up their alley, I will simply end by saying that if you have not read this series, you owe it to yourself to do so now! To those who have read the first two and haven't gotten around to reading book 3, you really need to make some time to indulge yourself into this world again.
history.review_full:
I have no clue how I totally spaced and didn't write a review after finishing this book.. but I did.

This third installment of J.L. Clayton's trilogy swept me away. Answers to questions I'd had since book 1 were answered, as well as a couple from book 2. The story line flowed seamlessly from the closing in book 2 to the beginning of book 3 just as flawlessly as the transition from book 1 to book 2. Clayton's style of writing is a newly discovered obsession of mine that I can't seem to get enough of. It is easy to understand what she is wanting and trying to convey (read: no mental mind games). Her characters continue to grow throughout the chapters and the plot thickens to a delicious climax at the end. I could not flip through my copy and devour this story fats enough. I took one break only due to being forced to plug my Kindle in to recharge and I don't have a plug in a location where I can sit and continue to read while it is charging. That was the only problem (and slight frustration) I encountered while reading this brilliant book. In fear of giving spoilers for those who have yet to read this series and are here to read reviews to see if it is up their alley, I will simply end by saying that if you have not read this series, you owe it to yourself to do so now! To those who have read the first two and haven't gotten around to reading book 3, you really need to make some time to indulge yourself into this world again. Your imagination will thank you. :)
history.review_title: Brilliant Addition to a Superb Series

product.title: A Ghost of Magic: Chosen Saga Book 3

history.review_excerpt:
How, I'm a few decades out of my teens LOL but I can relate to where the main character was coming from. something I greatly appreciated.

Bottom line: the editing was superbly done, the characters are now extremely well established, as is the plot, for the next book. I thoroughly enjoyed reading this and only paused before starting book #2 to leave this review. Yes, there is a fair amount of teenage agnst and a love triangle, kind of.. but it is presented in such a way that you forget you aren't dealing with college students until you're reminded that this is technically a high school.

The only thing I would recommend to the author or editor: please don't make the beginning of each chapter a huge white box!
history.review_full:
The author did a wonderful job introducing each character and giving just enough info to round them out in my brain. I especially loved how each character had their own unique personality. Some books I've read recently have had all the characters nearly the same with only a few distinguishing differences. I loved the dialog! How, I'm a few decades out of my teens LOL but I can relate to where the main character was coming from. Anytime she started to edge toward being too whiny or complaining too much, her heroine traits kicked in helping her to never actually cross the threshold into the bratty know-it-all category.. something I greatly appreciated.

Bottom line: the editing was superbly done, the characters are now extremely well established, as is the plot, for the next book. I thoroughly enjoyed reading this and only paused before starting book #2 to leave this review. Yes, there is a fair amount of teenage agnst and a love triangle, kind of.. but it is presented in such a way that you forget you aren't dealing with college students until you're reminded that this is technically a high school.

The only thing I would recommend to the author or editor: please don't make the beginning of each chapter a huge white box! I read my Kindle books in bed at night, with my brightness reduced to zero and those white boxes would constantly blind me!

product.title: Elsewhere

history.review_excerpt:
All 15 hours on Kindle I was truly fascinated by Eliza Hamilton and the amazing life she led. She knew many of the great men and women of our country. As for the men, my opinion has changed for the not so good on a few of them.

I admit I saw Hamilton and after the show I really wanted to learn more about Eliza. The men made all the history books, got all the credit but the ladies, Eliza, Martha, Dolly (to name a few) played an important roll in our Nation's history, birth and growth.

How she lived to 97 in a time when many were taken by illness (most frightening was the yellow fever) with limited medicine is also amazing.
history.review_full:
First let me say just wow! This is not my typical read and I couldn't put it down. All 15 hours on Kindle I was truly fascinated by Eliza Hamilton and the amazing life she led. Strong, intelligent, fearless driven woman ahead of her times. She knew many of the great men and women of our country. As for the men, my opinion has changed for the not so good on a few of them.

I admit I saw Hamilton and after the show I really wanted to learn more about Eliza. The work, effort, loves and loss she suffered and she came out on top. She deserves to be remembered. The men made all the history books, got all the credit but the ladies, Eliza, Martha, Dolly (to name a few) played an important roll in our Nation's history, birth and growth.

How she lived to 97 in a time when many were taken by illness (most frightening was the yellow fever) with limited medicine is also amazing. I am a fan of hers now and have learned much about her husband and his passion for our country. Well done and well written.
history.review_title: There would be no Founding Fathers without Founding Mothers & Wives.

history.review_excerpt:
This story blew me away! I couldn't wait to read what was coming next. Close friends, tons of history together, time for secrets to surface and just when I thought the cards were all out on the table, another zinger. Serious life situations but also humor and funny dialog. This book has it all. For those of you who like to read the last page first....DON'T. Let the story flow and get to know the characters. Loved them all.
This has one of the coolest epilogues and again, do not cheat. Very satisfying story. What a ride! How fast can Shari Low write?

history.review_excerpt: I'm playing catch up with Shari Low stories. All different and twists, turns and surprises. You just never know what road the characters are going to go down. Love smart women and tight bonds. Laney, smart and loved how she dealt with what was thrown at her. Millie so sweet, is her heart in the right place where Leo is concerned? Tash, great wit and snark. Not a women I would aspire to be but why not? Men live their lives like that all the time. Cam, can he really be the scum husband we think? Go ahead and find out. At times, I get so mad I have to walk away but not for long. Always a satisfying read.

history.review_excerpt: I thought the last book was not great, but this one was just plain boring. I truly hope it's leading up to something great because that last book in DC was so fabulous but I'm not sure how many more skippable books I can take. I have no clue where all the 5 star reviews are coming from--I guess from folks more loyal than me? I love Robert and his Sienna books, but there are still a few that I deem "skippable"--and two in a row is pretty rough to take. There were some things said in the book that made it seem like the dullness was on purpose--like Sienna's feeling that way about her life again back in MN, and maybe we're supposed to feel it too? I hope Sienna catches a break soon though, because boy does she need one!
history.review_full: Oi. This one was kind of dreadful. Very dull. It went absolutely nowhere and almost nothing happened. Dragged on and on, all with repeated events (fights or encounters) that were exactly the same with the same results. I thought the last book was not great, but this one was just plain boring. I truly hope it's leading up to something great because that last book in DC was so fabulous but I'm not sure how many more skippable books I can take. I have no clue where all the 5 star reviews are coming from--I guess from folks more loyal than me? I love Robert and his Sienna books, but there are still a few that I deem "skippable"--and two in a row is pretty rough to take. There were some things said in the book that made it seem like the dullness was on purpose--like Sienna's feeling that way about her life again back in MN, and maybe we're supposed to feel it too? Yikes. I hope Sienna catches a break soon though, because boy does she need one! I kind of wish she'd go back to TN if MN wants to kick her out.

history.review_excerpt:
I read the First Law trilogy, which came oh-so-highly recommended in a fantasy group I'm in. There's almost zero magic in these books though, so if that's what you're looking for then you can look elsewhere.
As far as this book goes, I was mostly bored. It kind of dragged on because the main character (Monza) had a list of people she wanted revenge on and that list was a little long, but that's the entire focus of the book. I'm not sure they made it worth reading this book--maybe--but I doubt I'm going to spend the time to reread this book or any of the First Law. Joe is a great writer though--I've highlighted a lot of passages in his books.
history.review_full:
I read the First Law trilogy, which came oh-so-highly recommended in a fantasy group I'm in. It was alright, I guess. There's almost zero magic in these books though, so if that's what you're looking for then you can look elsewhere.
As far as this book goes, I was mostly bored. It kind of dragged on because the main character (Monza) had a list of people she wanted revenge on and that list was a little long, but that's the entire focus of the book. I liked Shivers, but then something happened and he changed into a different person that I didn't like. And I never liked Monza, so basing a book more or less on these two at the top was pretty irritating to me.
My favorite was Cosca, followed by Friendly. I'm not sure they made it worth reading this book--maybe--but I doubt I'm going to spend the time to reread this book or any of the First Law. I think this is where I'm calling it quits with these books, which is unfortunate because of people's general obsession with them. I don't really get it. Joe is a great writer though--I've highlighted a lot of passages in his books. I just don't think I'm interested enough in grim dark to stay with him.

product.title: Best Served Cold (World of the First Law Book 1)

history.review_excerpt:
The writing isn't terrible itself, but some things are not written clearly or there are continuity problems, like these two:

1) We found out pages after the fact that Magda's tree has been burned, when as far as we knew up to that point she had only been carried off by the dragon, not burned. I had thought maybe there was a chance she survived somewhere, but then got confused because I am supposed to assume she burned to death before being carried off now?

2) Rose took off her gloves and threw them at the dragon, they aren't mentioned again, and then pages later her gloves were removed in the cave. I know it's a little thing to gripe about, but every time something like this happens I'm pulled right out of the story and it matters.

Having glazed glass windows in a castle in the 12th century I think I'd a bit of a stretch, but whatever.
history.review_full:
Like do many others have said, this book has potential. Had.

Like a typical cringy teenager, she thinks she's in love with a boy she's exchanged about a dozen words with. Ok.

This book needs editing and fact checking at the very least. The writing isn't terrible itself, but some things are not written clearly or there are continuity problems, like these two:

1) We found out pages after the fact that Magda's tree has been burned, when as far as we knew up to that point she had only been carried off by the dragon, not burned. I had thought maybe there was a chance she survived somewhere, but then got confused because I am supposed to assume she burned to death before being carried off now?

2) Rose took off her gloves and threw them at the dragon, they aren't mentioned again, and then pages later her gloves were removed in the cave. I know it's a little thing to gripe about, but every time something like this happens I'm pulled right out of the story and it matters.

Having glazed glass windows in a castle in the 12th century I think I'd a bit of a stretch, but whatever. What bugged me was the bird that hit the window. You can tell the writer is American here. The story takes place on an island not very far from England, and she said the robin that hit the window had a red breast. Only American Robins have red breasts. European Robins have orange breasts.

On top of that, multiple times in the book she refers to dragon eggs having the same Robin-egg-blue coloring, except European Robin eggs are not blue. A little fact checking can go a long way.

This girl apparently can light a fire using presumably wet materials after a rainstorm using nothing but her mother's pocket mirror to reflect the sun--assuming the sun shines bright and hot after a rain (how often does that actually happen? In the book, apparently relatively often). Right.

The dragon assumes she blew the fire from her belly herself, and she might as well have for how realistic it would be to accomplish. She must be pretty talented with that fancy mirror from the 12th century, when mirrors were only just barely beginning to be made well, and a pocket one at that.

I gave up at 69% while she's on an island supposedly carving her own boat out of charred wood with rocks and she's learned dragon language. Ok. Starting fires after downpours with a supposed mirror was the last time I felt like rolling my eyes. I just don't care what happens to her or anyone else so what's the point?
history.review_title: Too annoying with lack of editing and fact checking.

product.title: Dragon's Keep

heldout.review_excerpt:
I barely made it through all the journal entries at the beginning as back story. When I finally got to Beka, I had the horror of realizing the entire book consisted of journal entries. "I....I...I....".
What really ticks me is that I'd bought the entire series ahead of time. When I checked the other books to see if they're all written like this, I determined there's no way I'm going to be able to stick through a whole series in this awful format. This is my last series to read by Tamora and I loved all of her other stuff, so why would I suspect I'd despise this one? A good waste of $25 and a real let down at the end.
heldout.review_full:
Diary entries in the first person? Really? I barely made it through all the journal entries at the beginning as back story. When I finally got to Beka, I had the horror of realizing the entire book consisted of journal entries. "I....I...I....".
What really ticks me is that I'd bought the entire series ahead of time. When I checked the other books to see if they're all written like this, I determined there's no way I'm going to be able to stick through a whole series in this awful format. This is my last series to read by Tamora and I loved all of her other stuff, so why would I suspect I'd despise this one? A good waste of $25 and a real let down at the end. I still have her newest book to read, I guess.

history.review_excerpt: I'd taken a long break from my genealogy research, so I had no idea that my former favorite software was now produced by Ancestry.com. It was so frustrating to have to try to remember the steps over and over again to get to the different pages I needed. A great site and all, but I don't need to be continuously reminded of it. I felt like they broke what didn't need to be fixed, and looking at the reviews of the past versions, this year's is an "improvement" but they need to go a lot further. The free months subscription is nice and all, but they really need to make it more user friendly like the Broderbund versions of Family Tree Maker.
history.review_full: I'd taken a long break from my genealogy research, so I had no idea that my former favorite software was now produced by Ancestry.com. After loading it I began to wonder what had happened to what I'd felt was the best program out there. The learning curve for the software is steep, it's not intuitive at all. It was so frustrating to have to try to remember the steps over and over again to get to the different pages I needed. Ugh. The program seems to be designed now to be a big advertisement to Ancestry.com. A great site and all, but I don't need to be continuously reminded of it. I felt like they broke what didn't need to be fixed, and looking at the reviews of the past versions, this year's is an "improvement" but they need to go a lot further. The free months subscription is nice and all, but they really need to make it more user friendly like the Broderbund versions of Family Tree Maker.

product.title: Family Tree Maker 2011 Deluxe [Old Version]

heldout.review_excerpt:
Like many others, my husband & I chose a different software (H & R Block) for our 2014 tax return because we were unhappy with the product features left out for that version. Thankfully, Intuit listened and our preferred features are back. Installation was simple, no issues with Windows 10, and TurboTax easily accessed our 2014 forms from the H & R Block software. We installed the software 12/29/15 and it prompted us for updates, so it appears that Intuit is staying on top of reported issues. Now we just have to wait until our employers send our W-2s.

If TurboTax was your favorite tax software prior to the 2014 changes, I'd recommend trying them again.

history.review_excerpt:
The concept is nice, but the decimal point is hard to find on the Kindle Fire (software v. Hitting the "x" in the number entry box also clears the numbers in the box.

I rather like the Tip Calculator, which makes it easy to divide a restaurant check for a group of people. When you input the check total, the number of people, and the tip percentage, the app will return each person's share (including her/his share of the tip).

However, this app is awkward to use, if you have to work to get a decimal point option for entering decimal or dollar and cent amounts. If the developer should update the app to fix this Kindle Fire flaw, I would rate the app at 4 or 5 stars.
history.review_full:
The concept is nice, but the decimal point is hard to find on the Kindle Fire (software v. 6.03). When I open the app or one of its calculator options (Percent, Percent Increase, Percent Discount, Tip Calculator, Percent Margin, Percentage Change, Percentage of), only the keyboard shows--and the keyboard has NO decimal point/period key.

If I turn the Kindle Fire to change the display from horizontal to vertical, or vice versa, the "spell checker" line with punctuation options USUALLY appears above the keyboard. This line includes a decimal point/period that works for purposes of entering the calculations. Also, if I hit the "x" inside the number entry box (the "x" is in gray, at the right), it will USUALLY bring up the punctuation options line. Hitting the "x" in the number entry box also clears the numbers in the box.

I rather like the Tip Calculator, which makes it easy to divide a restaurant check for a group of people. When you input the check total, the number of people, and the tip percentage, the app will return each person's share (including her/his share of the tip).

However, this app is awkward to use, if you have to work to get a decimal point option for entering decimal or dollar and cent amounts. If the developer should update the app to fix this Kindle Fire flaw, I would rate the app at 4 or 5 stars.
history.review_title: Nice Concept, Decimal Point Hard to Find on Kindle Fire

Right after the 1st Gen Kindle Fire was released, I started using the original GSam Battery Monitor (then known as the Badass Battery Monitor) as a one-tap solution to monitoring the Fire's remaining charge and battery usage. I liked the app so well, I upgraded to the special Kindle Fire version when it was released, and have been using it ever since.

Today I received my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" Wi-Fi tablet, and was delighted to find that this GSam Battery Monitor (Kindle Tablet Edition) works with new tablet as well! You can then check your battery usage and charge by swiping down from the top of the 8.9" screen.

Kudos to the GSam developer, for issuing regular updates and improvements to the original, excellent battery app, and for having it immediately ready to go with the new, larger Kindle Fire tablets.
history.review_full:
Right after the 1st Gen Kindle Fire was released, I started using the original GSam Battery Monitor (then known as the Badass Battery Monitor) as a one-tap solution to monitoring the Fire's remaining charge and battery usage. I liked the app so well, I upgraded to the special Kindle Fire version when it was released, and have been using it ever since.

You only need to download your purchased app and install it. You can then check your battery usage and charge by swiping down from the top of the 8.9" screen.

Kudos to the GSam developer, for issuing regular updates and improvements to the original, excellent battery app, and for having it immediately ready to go with the new, larger Kindle Fire tablets.

history.review_excerpt:
(Crosswords Plus does not download your NY Times subscription puzzles automatically, although it makes it easy to download them daily; it doesn't come with puzzles loaded, although it points you to free Internet sources; and it doesn't have a feature for comparing scores with other solvers.) In addition, [[ASIN:B005U6QIMI Crosswords Plus]] allows you to resize the grid, offers an alternate clues-only view, includes the usual hints options, and has navigational settings (skipping boxes, etc.) that are fully functional on the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet.

Even if this CROSSWORDS app worked perfectly, I would still prefer [[ASIN:B005U6QIMI Crosswords Plus]]. For this reason, and because of the high price and current Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet issues, I rate CROSSWORDS at 3 stars.
history.review_full:
CROSSWORDS by Standalone is a decent crossword puzzle app, but inflexible and expensive. On my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet, the working display shows about two-thirds of a weekday NY Times puzzle grid, and I can't find any way to resize the grid to show the whole puzzle at once. (You must swipe down or hit an arrow button to reveal the lower one-third of the grid.) The Across and Down clues appear alongside the grid in a readable typeface, but the clues are cut off at the right. (Perhaps this is an 8.9" Kindle Fire HD issue that the developer will correct; fortunately, clicking on a cut-off clue will display the full clue below the grid.)

The puzzle hints--found under the list icon beside the app icon, at the left--don't always work as expected. For example, "reveal entire puzzle" only filled in one word (for the 1-down clue) when I started from the "hints for 1-down" screen. In contrast, "reveal entire puzzle" filled in the entire puzzle when I started from a "press-and-hold-on-clue" popup. Worse, the general settings for navigation (e.g., "skip filled squares", "show mistakes") don't seem to function at all. (Perhaps this is another Kindle Fire HD issue for the developer to fix.)

The app allows you to enter multiple letters in a single square, and to look up puzzle info (must-haves for NY Times crossword solvers). If you are a NY Times crosswords subscriber, the app will automatically download the daily puzzles for you. The app comes with an assortment of puzzles already installed, and allows you to browse for and download many more puzzles from the Internet. It also allows you to establish an account and compare your times with other solvers.

However, the FREE [[ASIN:B005U6QIMI Crosswords Plus]] app does nearly all of the same things. (Crosswords Plus does not download your NY Times subscription puzzles automatically, although it makes it easy to download them daily; it doesn't come with puzzles loaded, although it points you to free Internet sources; and it doesn't have a feature for comparing scores with other solvers.) In addition, [[ASIN:B005U6QIMI Crosswords Plus]] allows you to resize the grid, offers an alternate clues-only view, includes the usual hints options, and has navigational settings (skipping boxes, etc.) that are fully functional on the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet.

Even if this CROSSWORDS app worked perfectly, I would still prefer [[ASIN:B005U6QIMI Crosswords Plus]]. For this reason, and because of the high price and current Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet issues, I rate CROSSWORDS at 3 stars.
history.review_title: Decent, But Expensive; Not Fully Functional on New Kindle Fire HD 8.9" Tablet

Because I make movies only for products reviewed on Amazon, I lack the time and motivation to overcome the relatively steep learning curve required for using this full-featured software to good effect.

Once again, I have reverted to using the simplistic Microsoft Movie Maker software for compiling slideshows and editing short movies to accompany reviews. It's plenty good enough for my purposes, especially given how much the Amazon photo and movie processing takes away from my submitted high-quality photo and movie files.

history.review_excerpt: Generally I don't like bundled packages, but this combination seems to work flawlessly. The firewall doesn't have much configurability, so if that's important to you, you might want to just get the antivirus product instead of the combo, but you can turn off the firewall if you want. I don't recall having much of an issue with the 2007 version, but some earlier versions were just horrendous. If you can deal with a sometimes quirky install and finally get it working, the payoff is well worth the struggle. Since the product works so well once up and running it is rare that you would even need support; most likely you'll need it an install time.
history.review_full: I have used Panda Antivirus for many years and I can't recall ever getting a virus or at least none that caused any damage.  Once in a while I will check my system with another scanner just to see if Panda is preventing viruses and it appears to be doing an excellent job.  Rarely do I ever find any viruses that are able to slip by Panda.  You won't find a better antivirus prevention program.  It also does a good job on automatic updates.  It's non-intrusive and runs quietly in the background.  The additional protection of the firewall is a plus and the firewall seems to work well too.  Generally I don't like bundled packages, but this combination seems to work flawlessly.  The firewall doesn't have much configurability, so if that's important to you, you might want to just get the antivirus product instead of the combo, but you can turn off the firewall if you want.  The real downside to Panda is that sometimes the install can be a nightmare.  I don't recall having much of an issue with the 2007 version, but some earlier versions were just horrendous.  If you can deal with a sometimes quirky install and finally get it working, the payoff is well worth the struggle.  Some of the easier to install, better known competitors just don't provide as much protection.  Something else to be aware of is that Webroot SpySweeper (a popular anti-spyware program) had some serious conflicts with Panda's scan.  This is not the fault of Panda and Webroot has corrected most of the conflicts in their current version.  There still appears to be one big conflict, but there is a workaround for it.  Panda's support can be a little spotty at times.  Sometimes I have gotten good response; other times it has been a bit slow.  They always seem to respond even if it takes a while.  Since the product works so well once up and running it is rare that you would even need support; most likely you'll need it an install time.  If you are building a new system, install it early and you shouldn't have any issues.  As security products tend to get more comprehensive, there are a bound to be more conflicts and if you try to run multiple products you can have difficulty.  Panda seems no worse (and no better) than any others in that regard.  I highly recommend it even with the caveats mentioned here.

product.title: Panda Antivirus + Firewall 2007

history.review_excerpt: This newer version appears to have been trimmed down a lot, so it should run fast enough on most systems. My system is rather old, so not as responsive as newer systems with better processors and more memory. The first scan of my system took under 2 hours, which is about the same as most other products that I have used. That's nice if you really want to clean your system well, but can be misleading in making you think that this product is catching so much more than others, since other scanners often ignore most cookies. This seems like an adequate security program for most needs, but apparently lacks a firewall. I am not overly impressed with it, but it still holds it's own reasonably well against competitors.
history.review_full: In the past I used Webroot products, but finally abandoned them as they just took too many resources and slowed my system.  This newer version appears to have been trimmed down a lot, so it should run fast enough on most systems.  My system is rather old, so not as responsive as newer systems with better processors and more memory.  The first scan of my system took under 2 hours, which is about the same as most other products that I have used.  My main criticism of the scanner is that it comes up with a lot of mostly harmless cookies.  That's nice if you really want to clean your system well, but can be misleading in making you think that this product is catching so much more than others, since other scanners often ignore most cookies.  I seem to recall a lot more features in older versions of this software; this version appears to be stripped down somewhat.  That's probably a good thing, as you don't want your security software too complicated or difficult to set up.  It is better if it sits quietly doing it's thing without needing a lot of tweaks.  This seems like an adequate security program for most needs, but apparently lacks a firewall.  I am not overly impressed with it, but it still holds it's own reasonably well against competitors.  I just think there are somewhat better security programs available.

product.title: Webroot AntiVirus with Spy Sweeper 3-User [Old Version]

history.review_excerpt:
It does take a while to install; about 1/2 hour or so on my older PC. The program loads quickly and runs well, even though it is a big program consisting of 5 separate components. It's not that there is anything difficult that I encountered; just so much to learn before you can do that much. The product includes access to a lot of on-line art, which is a plus, although I noticed some of that art had watermarks, which would render it less usable and might require an additional subscription fee to remove the watermarks. I tested on Windows 7, but I'm sure it works fine on 8 and 10 as well.
It has both 32 and 64 bit versions on the disk.
history.review_full:
I have used simple drawing programs before, but thought it was time to really try a full featured one. The install of this program went perfectly; no issues at all and was easy; just a few simple questions to answer. It does take a while to install; about 1/2 hour or so on my older PC. The program loads quickly and runs well, even though it is a big program consisting of 5 separate components. It seems comprehensive enough to do any and all graphics work that you might want to accomplish. I was able to create some simple objects and fill them with various colors and text fairly quickly. The programs include some basic tutorials that help you get started, but they aren't extensive enough to really learn the product comprehensively. The box shows some gorgeous drawings that were created with the program. The problem is that you won't be able to quickly create anything that is even close to as good in just a short time. This program takes a real learning commitment. Some things are intuitive, but not everything. If you haven't used a somewhat sophisticated drawing program previously, it will take some time to get up to speed with this. I felt a bit overwhelmed. It's not that there is anything difficult that I encountered; just so much to learn before you can do that much. Some of the terminology had me confused and the number of toolbars and items on them is overwhelming at first. There are tool and menu bars across the top of the screen and toolbars down both sides too. The bars change too, depending on what you are doing. The sheer number of different controls and buttons requires a big time commitment to learn this complex program. It probably also helps to have some drawing skill, especially with a mouse. After working with the main drawing program for a while, I got the feeling that to master this would require a training course. Teaching yourself to use this in the way you want would take far longer than learning it in a class. I didn't spend time looking to see if there were other tutorials or training courses available. I only knocked off one star in my review for the difficulty in learning the product in order to use in an effective way. The product includes access to a lot of on-line art, which is a plus, although I noticed some of that art had watermarks, which would render it less usable and might require an additional subscription fee to remove the watermarks. There is plenty of art that doesn't have the watermarks and you can always capture images or use your own photos as well. If you want a complete, comprehensive drawing program, this is it. Just be prepared to spend a lot of hours learning. I tested on Windows 7, but I'm sure it works fine on 8 and 10 as well.
It has both 32 and 64 bit versions on the disk.
history.review_title: VERY COMPLEX, RICH PROGRAM WITH BIG LEARNING CURVE

product.title: CorelDRAW Graphics Suite X8 - Amazon Exclusive - Includes RAW Photo Editor (Old Version)

heldout.review_excerpt: Unfortunately that product had slipped in the ratings in recent years and my subscription was about to run out so decided to try Kaspersky, which I had read very good things about. They also have built in secure browser capability, so you can do online banking without worrying about data being exposed (called Safe Money) and another one called secure connection. So why only 4 stars? I was disappointed when I opened the package, because it is nothing except an activation key and a few pages of instructions. You won't go wrong with Kaspersky, but remember nothing will protect you completely. You can convert from FAT32 to NTFS, but there are risks of losing your data if you do that.
heldout.review_full: Over the years I have used many different antivirus and internet security products including AVG, Panda, Trend Micro, Symantec (Norton), Bitdefender, McAfee, Webroot, Avast!, Vipre (GFI) and various others.  They all had strengths and weaknesses and eventually I would have to abandon one and move on to another.  I finally settled on one that I have used for a number of years now.  Unfortunately that product had slipped in the ratings in recent years and my subscription was about to run out so decided to try Kaspersky, which I had read very good things about.  Keep in mind that these days a simple anti-virus program isn't enough to keep you secure.  You either need to use multiple products that protect from different kinds of threats or you need a more comprehensive package of protection.  The best security products also now include checking for updates on common programs that most computers have (such as browsers).  Kaspersky Total Security has that.  They also have built in secure browser capability, so you can do online banking without worrying about data being exposed (called Safe Money) and another one called secure connection.  It wasn't clear what the difference between the two is and secure connection is limited to 200mb a day unless you pay extra to remove the limitation.  There is a lot in the product including the ability to encrypt files, a password manager and a system vulnerability scanner and fixer.  It even includes a backup and restore program and parental controls.  It doesn't seem too resource hungry, which is why I had to abandon some products in the past; they just slowed the computer too much.  Overall, it seems like a really nice package and rates highly in virus detection.  You won't go wrong buying this product.  So why only 4 stars?  Well, I am rating the specific package that I got.  I was disappointed when I opened the package, because it is nothing except an activation key and a few pages of instructions.  I ran into problems right away with the instructions.  It recommends signing up at my.kaspersky.com where you can enter and manage your license(s).  I tried repeatedly to add my license after signing up and could not do it; kept getting the message that it wasn't able to and to try again later.  Finally it just said the license had expired.  I gave up and used a different tactic and I recommend you do this too if you buy one of these license packages.  I just went to the main website, downloaded and installed the product.  Then when I ran it, it requested the activation key, which I entered.  Everything went fine then.  A word about support.  When I ran into the difficultly on my.kaspersky.com, I contacted support and they responded very quickly in just a few hours.  I hope this is an indication of their usual levels of support.  I was impressed.  You won't go wrong with Kaspersky, but remember nothing will protect you completely.  There is no substitute for practicing safe computing.  Update: Kaspersky will not install on Windows XP if your disks are FAT32.  Your disks have to be NTFS.  You can convert from FAT32 to NTFS, but there are risks of losing your data if you do that.
heldout.review_title: Very comprehensive and easy to use; installation instructions were useless
