history.review_full:
Trend Micro Titanium Maximum Security is an excellent protective software that runs quietly in the background while you use your personal computer for everyday tasks. Trend monitors your internet activity and squashes spyware, viruses, malware, and more before they have a chance to infect your computer.

I have had very good success with Trend security software and my previous satisfaction with this product led me to obtain a copy of this latest Trend product. I haven't been disappointed in the least. Right from the beginning, this software product proves its usefulness, starting with the quick installation. The software installs so quickly you wonder if something wasn't done correctly or if you missed a step. But it really is that fast and it goes to work immediately, pretecting against threats and providing much needed peace of mind.

I have used a few other security software products in the past and many have proven acceptable, but still had their annoyances and the chief one is the tendency of many security software products to slow down your computer. Trend security software doesn't cause this problem. My computer runs as fast as normal and if I didn't know it, I wouldn't even guess that security software was installed at all. Another annoyance is pop- up reminders. Now, I realize that some individuals like these reminders because they consider them an extra layer of protection. But I would rather not see the reminders to check for threats and just remember to click the appropriate link and view them when I want to. Trend spares you the constant reminders while protecting your computer they way you want to be protected.

Another area where Trend Micro shines is with parental controls. My girls are young but they are slowly developing an interest in computers and I feel much better knowing that my Trend parental settings are in place, protecting against the possibility that one of my kids will link into the wrong site. And I like that Trend offers so many different levels of child protection. This allows a parent to select the appropriate level for the age of the child.

Internet security software is critical and Trend Micro Titanium Maximum Security is one of the best security protection software products I have ever used. Quick loading, quiet background operation, no slowdowns, and full protection make this a software product that earns an easy stamp of approval.

history.review_excerpt:
Rosetta Stone is the market leader in language education and this, Rosetta Stone Totale Italian lessons 1-5, is yet another effective entry in the Rosetta Stone line. But regardless, you shouldn't purchase this product expecting to speak perfect, fluent Italian by the end of the fifth lesson. You won't speak perfect Italian after using this product, but your foreign language prowess will improve.

Learning a foreign language is part of many individual to- do lists, but classroom instruction isn't the best way to achieve this goal. A system such as that provided by Rosetta Stone is far more effective than reading a book and while the price is high, the final results are certainly worth it.
history.review_full:
Rosetta Stone is the market leader in language education and this, Rosetta Stone Totale Italian lessons 1-5, is yet another effective entry in the Rosetta Stone line. This product immerses the student in the Italian language, teaching eager learners how to speak Italian in less time than with traditional classroom instruction.

Rosetta Stone Totale Italian follows the same Rosetta Stone formula that has made the product so helpful and so useful to students of foreign languages. Rather than teaching via memorization, Rosetta Stone teaches more directly. Students are given exercises that deal with direct conversation and include special speech recognition software. The Rosetta Stone system provides instant feedback, letting the student know exactly where he/she is excelling and where improvement is needed.

Among the helpful features, the one I like best is the RS world feature. It allows the student to converse directly with a native Italian speaker and the two speak back in forth in both English and Italian. Through this direct immersion, the student quickly learns how to pronounce certain words and, most importantly, how to put everything together into complete sentences and conversation. This system is much more effective and it teaches the language at a much faster pace than with ordinary, classroom langauage instruction.

If there is one word of caution I could give to anxious students yearning to speak fluent Italian it would be to not set your expectations too high. Yes, the Rosetta Stone system is effective and millions of satisfied customers swear by its methodology. But regardless, you shouldn't purchase this product expecting to speak perfect, fluent Italian by the end of the fifth lesson. Some people, based on all of the positive reviews they read, purchase this system and expect miracles. Then, the product doesn't deliver the impossible and so they rate it lower. You won't speak perfect Italian after using this product, but your foreign language prowess will improve.

Learning a foreign language is part of many individual to- do lists, but classroom instruction isn't the best way to achieve this goal. A system such as that provided by Rosetta Stone is far more effective than reading a book and while the price is high, the final results are certainly worth it. The cost of Rosetta Stone is still less than that of most instructional classes and the learning curve is shorter, making this a very good product for the determined student.
history.review_title: Learn Italian the Rosetta Stone Way

product.title: Learn Italian: Rosetta Stone Italian - Level 1-5 Set

This latest version, McAfee Antivirus 2012 for 3 Users, is as good as ever, and I feel very confident that it will protect my information from harm.

McAfee Antivirus 2012 allows for loading on up to three different pc's for a single price and this makes it very useful for those who have pc's scattered around the house and do not want to invest in a separate antivirus purchase for each. So, if I install one on May 1, another on June 1, and a third pc on July 1, all three will reach their expiration on May 1. This is a small annoyance, but it really doesn't matter too much for me because I tend to load the antivirus on all three pc's at once anyway.

Virus protection is very important and McAfee Antivirus 2012 is one of the better products available for this purpose.
history.review_full:
Antivirus is an important component of any operating system and its criticalness continues to grow in importance as more and more individuals find ways to infect computers, deliver spam, and otherwise do harm to the computers of others. I have used many antivirus software products and one that I continue to return to is McAfee. This latest version, McAfee Antivirus 2012 for 3 Users, is as good as ever, and I feel very confident that it will protect my information from harm.

McAfee Antivirus 2012 allows for loading on up to three different pc's for a single price and this makes it very useful for those who have pc's scattered around the house and do not want to invest in a separate antivirus purchase for each. Loading is easy and I like that McAfee Antivirus 2012 operates in the background, keeping your computer safe and without slowing down your processes. If you load a CD or anything else, it automatically scans and lets you know the coast is clear and when you schedule a nightly scan, it will tell you later if the scan didn't complete. These protections give me a safe, secure feeling and I can go about my day using my pc without worry.

McAfee Antivirus 2012 is great for fighting internet battles against viruses, spyware, and the like. If I had to find one small fault, it would be with the limitation with the three installations. If you don't install on three computers, you cannot install the remaining ones and expect it to last a full year. The countdown begins with the first install. So, if I install one on May 1, another on June 1, and a third pc on July 1, all three will reach their expiration on May 1. This is a small annoyance, but it really doesn't matter too much for me because I tend to load the antivirus on all three pc's at once anyway.

Virus protection is very important and McAfee Antivirus 2012 is one of the better products available for this purpose. It is much more intuitive than other antivirus products- so much so that a grade school age child could figure it out. It works the way an antivirus product should without slowing down your computer or causing any problems and it earns an enthusiastic recommendation.
history.review_title: McAfee Antivirus protects your pc around the clock

product.title: McAfee Antivirus Plus 2012 - 3 Users [Old Version]

I’ve used several different anti- virus software products in my days and found most of them good, but McAfee seems to be the one I return to with the greatest frequency. My pc still runs smoothly and I cannot even tell the software is doing its thing.

Internet security is not something to take lightly and this 2017 version of McAfee certainly gets the job done. heldout.review_full:
Internet security is critical. No matter how well we think we have stopped threats in their tracks or can avoid these threats altogether, internet thieves continue to find new ways to hack into our personal data. McAfee Internet Security 2017 provides the protection you need and is good for up to 10 devices- enough to cover all of the electronics in most homes.

I’ve used several different anti- virus software products in my days and found most of them good, but McAfee seems to be the one I return to with the greatest frequency. It’s as easy to install as ever before and it offers the peace of mind you need to conduct personal transactions online and browse without worry. This year’s version is about as simple to use as other recent years, and that mean it’s as good as I remember and better than the majority of others. All you do is enter a code in the McAfee web site and it downloads the protection. It’s really that simple. And with the true key feature, McAfee will remember logon passwords for you, eliminating the tendency many of us have to use the same password everywhere we go.

The greatest reason that anti- virus software scores low in my book is when it causes a slowdown in your pc’s speed. I have used some of the lesser- known anti- virus products and some of the better known and a large percentage of them slow your pc down to a crawl. Some slow it down so much that you’re tempted to halt the scan. There is no such issue with McAfee. My pc still runs smoothly and I cannot even tell the software is doing its thing.

Internet security is not something to take lightly and this 2017 version of McAfee certainly gets the job done. The guarantee is cool, too. If your pc gets infected with a virus, McAfee will remove it free of charge or your money back. This should make anyone feel safe and with the enhanced features and new risk detection capabilities, McAfee 2017 is easily one of the best internet security software products on the market.

product.title: McAfee 2017 Internet Security - 3 Devices

history.review_excerpt:
Consider this a minor complaint.

As soon as the project open, the fans in my computer kicked in and my CPU usage climbed up to 100% initially, then settled down to around 25%, give or take a little bit. Rendering to an MP4 or AVI (or similar format) obviously made the CPU usage peak at 100% and it ate a bunch of memory, but it settled back down as soon as it finished. I am no expert but I can product high-quality results in a shorter time span with Pinnacle, just because the application’s layout is more straightforward and easy to follow.

Though much older versions of Pinnacle Studio were a little easier on my system than this version, Version 23 is a good improvement over last year’s Version 22 which made my system work a lot harder.
history.review_full:
I have been a long-time user of Pinnacle Studio and I like it more than other video rendering programs I have used (and I have used several). Version 22 was a step back in terms of resource usage and it put quite a drain on the system when it was running and not even rendering. I was hopeful that this new version would do better. It is definitely an improvement over version 22 and does not tax the system quite as hard.

I installed from DVD and this took quite a while. It’s a big program that eats up more than 4GB of drive space when everything is installed so don’t expect it to install quickly. In my case it took about an hour before it finished, and that included downloading and installing a patch update from the Internet. When it was all finished it offered to open the application for me.

The first time the application is open the sample project is opened automatically. This is a project that shows a lot of the things that can be done, including video clips, soundtrack, and transition effects. This is the same project that has shipped with Pinnacle Studio for years. While it is fine for new customers, it would be nice to see a new project for those of us that have been around a while. Consider this a minor complaint.

As soon as the project open, the fans in my computer kicked in and my CPU usage climbed up to 100% initially, then settled down to around 25%, give or take a little bit. The main process that gobbled up cycles was NGStudio, followed by the Render Service. During playback (not rendering), CPU usage climbed to and hovered around 50% - much better than the 100% from the previous version. Rendering to an MP4 or AVI (or similar format) obviously made the CPU usage peak at 100% and it ate a bunch of memory, but it settled back down as soon as it finished. The finished video was clean and did not skip or have glitches.

Pinnacle Studio is a fairly complete application that allows you to import your own clips and pictures, and it provides a generous set of transition effects, text effects, sound clips and more. If you have ever worked with music production software like Acid, FLStudio, Garage Band or Cake Walk, the workflow is very similar only using different media elements.

Having worked with PowerDirector, VideoStudio and a couple of other solutions, Pinnacle Studio is cleaner and easier to understand. I am no expert but I can product high-quality results in a shorter time span with Pinnacle, just because the application’s layout is more straightforward and easy to follow.

Though much older versions of Pinnacle Studio were a little easier on my system than this version, Version 23 is a good improvement over last year’s Version 22 which made my system work a lot harder. Some serious under-the-hood improvements have gone into this version which for me would be enough to move to this version. If you are looking for a video production solution and want one that is easy to understand and produces good results, this is a good choice.

product.title: Pinnacle Studio 23 Ultimate - Advanced Video Editing and Screen Recording [PC Disc] [Old Version]

history.review_excerpt:
I have been using TurboTax since 2007 and so far it has worked out well for me. It is designed to be user-friendly, straightforward, easy and concise in getting the information it needs.

As always, it imported last year’s return without a hitch.

I haven’t finished my return yet as I have not yet received all of tax documents from some of my expected sources, but once I do I’ll e-file everything. Assuming that process is unchanged, it’s quick and easy using TurboTax’s built-in functions for e-filing both federal and state.

So far, my experience has been positive but I am still relatively early in the process.
history.review_full:
I have been using TurboTax since 2007 and so far it has worked out well for me. I like the interface, I like the way it imports last-year’s data and I like how it allows me to prepare and e-file returns for everyone in my household with one license. A new tax season is on us, and as such so is a new TurboTax.

This is the very first time I have been asked to activate my software, and this is probably overdue. Nothing prevented me from giving my install media away to someone else when I finished and allowing them to use it (I do still have all of my install media, though). With an activation feature, Intuit is being smarter than they once were about distributing their software.

However...there are a lot of people complaining about having to re-enter the code over and over, and then getting locked out. This is equally bad if not worse than not requiring activation, and in the long run this will cost them business. So far, my copy only needed to be activated one time, and hopefully that’s where it will stay. If it does do that to me, I will update this review and will switch software moving forward.

There are two ways to install, from a CD and from a download. I used the CD as I have always done and it was smooth and relatively painless. It took maybe 5 minutes to install, and I suspect the download version will install faster. Regardless, I am up and running.

The interface is familiar, a Q&A style of back-and-forth between the software and the user. Even someone who is afraid of the computer should have no problem understanding and using this software. It is designed to be user-friendly, straightforward, easy and concise in getting the information it needs.

As always, it imported last year’s return without a hitch.

I haven’t finished my return yet as I have not yet received all of tax documents from some of my expected sources, but once I do I’ll e-file everything. Assuming that process is unchanged, it’s quick and easy using TurboTax’s built-in functions for e-filing both federal and state.

So far, my experience has been positive but I am still relatively early in the process. I expect no issues, unless the registration problem becomes a real headache. If Intuit has ironed out this problem, then TurboTax is a very good solution for filing your taxes this year. I will revisit this review and update as I find changes and/or issues, but for now I have had a positive experience so far.
history.review_title: So Far, Very Familiar Experience from Previous Versions

history.review_excerpt:
It is similar to a lot of other image organizers out there in format and layout (and even the color scheme), so if you have used other applications for organizing your photos this will be familiar ground.

This is neither the most capable nor the cheapest photo editing and organization tool available, but what it does it does well. If you are looking for absolute control over your images and want to make highly complex and intricate adjustments this is probably not the tool you want, but if you want to make some easy to intermediate adjustments or want a template-based approach as a starting point, this is a fine tool for the job.
history.review_full:
I have been using PhotoDirector since version 8, and while it has some limitations (it is nowhere near as powerful as some of the other photo editors out there) it has a place in my arsenal of tools. For quick adjustments and some moderate photo editing it is a good tool for the asking price.

I will start by saying that there are photo editors available that cost less and do more advanced editing. When I want to make very detailed edits, such as removing objects or working in layers to adjust colors on very specific things in the photo, PhotoDirector is not the tool I generally use for these tasks. It can do these things, and it can do more, but every tool is different and some are easier to use than others. It is not a suitable replacement for a tool like PhotoShop, regardless, which has far more functionality going well beyond the basics.

For me, the greatest strength that PhotoDirector brings to the table is template-based quick adjustments. It comes with a set of presets already, and these are great for applying global changes to a photo quickly. There are some for working specifically with portraits, color and lighting enhancements, and even B/W filters with varying levels of exposure and contrast settings. The adjustments made can be taken as-is or the user can make additional tweaks to a variety of factors - temperature, exposure compensation, saturation, contrast and more.

The program provides access to a community where there are hundreds of additional, user-content templates as well. This requires creating an account there, for which there is no cost, and after setting up an account you can download as many of the presets as you desire. If you have a very wide variety of photographs you wish to process, the community-provided presets offer a lot of flexibility and are a big time saver. As with the presets included with the application, these can be used as-is or as a starting point.

Loading a lot of presets in the application can bog things down a lot. I probably have 30 presets downloaded, and with the older version I was using it could take close to a minute to load up an image because it ran through all of the presets and cached the rendered image - or the application would just hang. In this version the process of loading all of the presets seems to have been improved and the application loads images a lot faster. And, so far I have had no crashes or hangs.

In addition to providing photo editing, this application is a capable photo organizer and can help you get your image catalog straight. It is similar to a lot of other image organizers out there in format and layout (and even the color scheme), so if you have used other applications for organizing your photos this will be familiar ground.

This is neither the most capable nor the cheapest photo editing and organization tool available, but what it does it does well. It's well-suited for those looking for a tool for quick adjustments as well as keeping their photos organized. If you are looking for absolute control over your images and want to make highly complex and intricate adjustments this is probably not the tool you want, but if you want to make some easy to intermediate adjustments or want a template-based approach as a starting point, this is a fine tool for the job.
history.review_title: Capable Photo Editor/Organizer, Lots of Presets

product.title: Cyberlink PhotoDirector 12 Ultra [Mac Online Code]

history.review_excerpt:
The format support is one of the big selling points, but it is also a weakness in that in many cases, the imports almost work but still have some oddities and weirdness (correctable but still requiring effort). Most other suites provide a Linux variant of their software, but Corel does not.

So, why buy a suite like this when you can get a full suite for free or spend less for a 365 version of the most prevalent suite? In the case of 365 suites, sure, you pay less up front for those, but after the time period you pay for is up you lose access to the software and may no longer be able to access your documents if they’re in the suite’s native format. I do wish they had better support for Open Document formats, and the PDF import is a little iffy, but even so I am content to not have the dominant suite on my system.
history.review_full:
I am a longtime user of WordPerfect and definitely prefer it to the other major commercial office suite that is available. It might not be the most popular but it works very well and it continues to do everything I need. In a market packed with competition, the question is if this suite is still worth the investment, particularly when there are alternatives that are completely free for the downloading that compete quite well. In my opinion, WordPerfect is still a viable contender and is worth some consideration. It isn’t perfect by any means, but it does a lot of things right.

There are four components to this suite, and an extra application included as a bonus. WordPerfect is the word processor that was dominant in the DOS world and though it isn’t the major player it once was it is still maintained, updated and capable of producing professional results. Quattro Pro is a very capable spreadsheet. Presentations is a slideshow creation tool that is very comparable to PowerPoint. Lightning is the odd application in the suite, acting like a clipboard or notebook on steroids. And finally, AfterShot is Corel’s RAW photo file processing tool. I’ll address each separately.

WordPerfect is the star of the suite. It is a very fast, fully-capable word processor that competes well with most others available, and it comes with a few features that you won’t find elsewhere. One of the main advantages that it brings to the table is the Reveal Codes feature which lets you see (and mess with) the formatting codes that a document uses. If you just can’t get a document format straight, sometimes you can find the culprit in Reveal Codes mode and correct it there.

WordPerfect is able to open and export many document formats. The format support is one of the big selling points, but it is also a weakness in that in many cases, the imports almost work but still have some oddities and weirdness (correctable but still requiring effort). One format that I use frequently is ODT which permits me to move between Windows and Linux, and almost every time the document looks right but has a number of strange codes and mark-up symbols that require attention. Saving in WordPerfect’s native format does not make these go away; they still need to be addressed as they propagate to the new format. Simply deleting the symbols causes some aggravation as this sometimes messes with the document content. While it is able to import many formats, I am surprised occasionally by the ones that aren’t there; for example, support for multiple versions of Ami Pro is there but not for its successor, WordPro.

Quattro Pro as a spreadsheet is a solid contender. It is one of the fastest spreadsheet applications I have used and is arguably the most polished application interface-wise in the suite. It easily important and exports multiple formats, including XLSX files and 123 files, with few or no issues. However, it cannot import or export ODS file (Open Document Spreadsheet format) which is a bad oversight for interoperability and sharing.

Presentations is Corel’s answer to PowerPoint, and it imports/exports PPTX files with ease, though it does not work with ODP files (which is also a major oversight for interoperability). When importing PPTX files, I have seen the occasional font size issue, but this has been the extent of the issues I have seen and this is very easily fixed.

If you work with PowerPoint with any regularity, Presentations comes off as quite a shock as it bears little resemblance and the interface works very differently. The editor and panel arrangement areas are in separate full-client tabs so they cannot be viewed simultaneously. On the other hand, the slide outliner (separate tab) provides access to the slide contents in a notepaper-formatted type of list that can be edited and tweaked for fine control, which is different (and a little more straightforward) than is provided in most other slide show applications.

All three of these applications have some things in common. The interfaces are simple, uncluttered and mostly easy to understand and use, with the main functions and capabilities accessible by the default toolbars. These applications start up fast - faster than most of their competitors - and are ready to go quickly. They all support export to PDF which is a common feature in most office applications but isn’t always implemented very well. In the case of these applications, the export works much better than the import, particularly when working with PDF documents that contain embedded graphics. The support for Microsoft-specific formats is quite a bit better, with a high level of accuracy the large majority of the time (minor font and spacing quirks are the most common adjustments that occur).

Lightning is a bit of an odd duck. It works like a scrapbook application that allows you to add and delete content, open documents and view them, build up notebooks and manage them. It is reminiscent of OneNote or EverNote. This is a neat application for compiling information from different sources together in one place, so that notes and documents can be compiled and categorized. Surprisingly, it does not provide direct access to the Windows clipboard.

The suite comes bundled with AfterShot 3, Corel’s RAW photo editor. This is different than typical editors in that it has an emphasis on RAW formats for different manufacturers. My camera’s format is covered and as such it works with the files my camera produces. It is capable of doing the kinds of edits that you would expect from a generic photo editor, but it also can apply any number of presets and effects through available plug-ins. Be aware though that few of the plug-ins are included and need to be purchased, which for me is a deterrent.

For me, the very biggest downside to this suite is a distinct and glaring lack of Linux support. Most other suites provide a Linux variant of their software, but Corel does not.

So, why buy a suite like this when you can get a full suite for free or spend less for a 365 version of the most prevalent suite? In the case of the free suite, Corel stands behind their product and you can get them on the phone or answering emails when something goes wrong. In some environments, this is a requirement and using a community-supported suite is not permitted or is unfeasible because of policy. In the case of 365 suites, sure, you pay less up front for those, but after the time period you pay for is up you lose access to the software and may no longer be able to access your documents if they’re in the suite’s native format. Against other full licenses, Corel’s pricing is competitive.

I like Corel’s offering and will be using it on my Windows system. It’s fast and it works well the large majority of the time. I do wish they had better support for Open Document formats, and the PDF import is a little iffy, but even so I am content to not have the dominant suite on my system.
history.review_title: Fine Office Suite; A Little Room for Improvement Here and There

product.title: Corel WordPerfect Office Standard Upgrade 2021 | Office Suite of Word Processor, Spreadsheets & Presentation Software [PC Disc]

heldout.review_excerpt:
If you are piecing together a very large project, though, and need more than 6 or 24 tracks, you’ll need the Ultimate version.

The Ultimate edition adds 4K video support which is great if you need it. If you have the lower end of the required hardware set, expect this package to be really slow and expect your system to work very hard even on a small project.

One of the strongest features of this suite is the wide support for different video and image formats. Output formats are a little more limited but not unreasonable.

This is a good video suite if you work with video storyboarding and want to make your own videos, either for publishing online or for creating DVDs. It has just about everything but the kitchen sink when it comes to video production, but it comes at a steep price in terms of hardware requirements if you need it to run smoothly.
heldout.review_full:
I am a longtime user of Pinnacle Studio and have seen multiple iterations with the software, some better than others. I was curious to see how well this version fared when compared to older versions. While it’s a step forward in many ways, the hardware requirements have increased and it can get sluggish in operation.

As always, this software works similarly to music production software. The interface is a lot of click-and-drag operation, importing your content and adding it to the track grid and fitting in transition effects. You can add video, audio, text and more. Depending on the version of the software, you may have a limited number of tracks or an unlimited number, and for the majority of users the limits imposed by the base or Plus versions are not an issue. If you are piecing together a very large project, though, and need more than 6 or 24 tracks, you’ll need the Ultimate version.

The Ultimate edition adds 4K video support which is great if you need it. The lower versions do not have it.

Installation was easy as always. For the system I was using as the target there was no DVD player so I needed to get an external drive ready. This isn’t a problem unless you’re not expecting it. If you don’t have a DVD drive, use the download version instead (and to be honest, it’s faster to install that way anyway). Once installed, the software was ready to go and it came up in the familiar interface it has used in multiple previous revisions.

The render of video is the intensive processing part of the application, and as expected my system’s fans lit off during rendering, even when installed on a system with better specifications. It puts enough stress in the system that it impacts most other concurrent operations. While playback of the video appears choppy while it’s rendering, the final video is smooth.

The hardware requirements are the main concern I have when it comes to this application. It is expected that it would require a fairly beefy system, though even on a nicely equipped system it puts a good demand on the hardware during the render. If you have the lower end of the required hardware set, expect this package to be really slow and expect your system to work very hard even on a small project.

One of the strongest features of this suite is the wide support for different video and image formats. It can handle just about every common video format as well as many lesser-used formats, and the image format for stills is great. Output formats are a little more limited but not unreasonable.

This is a good video suite if you work with video storyboarding and want to make your own videos, either for publishing online or for creating DVDs. It has just about everything but the kitchen sink when it comes to video production, but it comes at a steep price in terms of hardware requirements if you need it to run smoothly.
heldout.review_title: Powerful Video Editing; High Hardware Requirements

history.review_full: A full year of language courses with fourteen different languages to pick from. I was kinda hoping for Chinese or Japanese but they weren't offered. There were the typical high school courses; Spanish, French, Italian & German none of which I wanted to explore again. There were interesting choices among them, Dutch, Indonesian and Turkish. I picked Russian. It starts off easy enough. Very basic conversational skills but my biggest problem is my Amazon Fire 10" tablet keyboard does NOT want to cooperate. I'm trying to do a drill where you pick the correct letters to complete a sentence and this keyboard, that I'm typing this review, is inserting double letters, spaces not letting me delete spaces. This is the device I want, have, to learn on. There's no where I can have the quiet and the time I need. I will try downloading Chrome but right now this is only partially successful and it seems like it could and should work better. Will update if I can resolve things.

history.review_excerpt:
When I installed it on my Mac laptop it installed fine, but crashed shortly after I tried to open a file.

So the project was shelved for a long time. However, the frustrations returned when I tried to open the downloaded dinosaur models, I have followed the import instructions and still cannot get them to open in Poser. After 6 hours I was finally able to get a model to show in poser, and it was awesome, it was doing exactly what I hoped, awkwardly but a start. I'm not giving up yet, but I am taking some time off to read the forums and try to tackle it again fresh.

Playing with the interface, it really is a slick software package.
history.review_full:
I got this software with what I thought was a fairly easy outcome in mind. I was going to work with my 11 year old to produce a small Jurassic Park like comic book. We were going to use some 3D dinosaur models, pose them as needed in Poser then composite them in photoshop to make the illustrations. All the parts seemed to be there but I keep running into issues.

First, I ended up having issues installing the software, two PC's refused to read the installation DVD. I was finally able to get my work PC to read the DVD and install the software but that was mostly to make sure the DVD was actually usable. When I installed it on my Mac laptop it installed fine, but crashed shortly after I tried to open a file.

So the project was shelved for a long time. I recently got a new MacBook Pro and loaded the software. I played with some of the installed examples and again got excited for the possibilities. However, the frustrations returned when I tried to open the downloaded dinosaur models, I have followed the import instructions and still cannot get them to open in Poser. After 6 hours I was finally able to get a model to show in poser, and it was awesome, it was doing exactly what I hoped, awkwardly but a start. Many tutorials later and I can fairly get it to do what I want for my stills.

The truly frustrating part is that just playing with it, I can tell what it could do for me. There is a learning curve for beginners. I'm not giving up yet, but I am taking some time off to read the forums and try to tackle it again fresh.

Playing with the interface, it really is a slick software package. I love the rigging and quick animation it allows. I'm posting questions and reading so I'll update if I'm able to get my models to work.
history.review_title: I Can See the Potential Throught the Frustrations

product.title: Poser 9

history.review_excerpt:
I have used Photoshop a lot but never used a work flow package other than iPhoto, so despite understanding the concepts of workflow I have not had any practical experience using any tool like Lightroom. So out of the box this was a little intimidating to use.

Setup/installation - This worked great other than having to update my Mac OS to 10.9 to get it to install. I batched a series of images of Marmots and Ground Squirrels in Alaska and took them from worthless to perfect in no time (if you subtract the time it took me to figure out how to get them all batch selected and then converted.

HDR - I was also excited to see that HDR is built in. But I was able to get highlights on the ice as well as details in underbrush so that is success.

Other things - It does look like there is a learning curve and I am still early in the process.
history.review_full:
I have been a serious amateur photographer for some time with more knowledge than talent. I have used Photoshop a lot but never used a work flow package other than iPhoto, so despite understanding the concepts of workflow I have not had any practical experience using any tool like Lightroom. So out of the box this was a little intimidating to use.

Setup/installation - This worked great other than having to update my Mac OS to 10.9 to get it to install. Once the OS was up to date, the actual installation was very quick, just a few minutes.

Starting Use - Here things got a little hairier. Much like Photoshop, there are lots of options, likely many that an individual will never use. The tool icons are familiar, but took a while to get the gyst and some old digital images imported. Immediately the things I like are the ability to change the white balance of batched photos. I batched a series of images of Marmots and Ground Squirrels in Alaska and took them from worthless to perfect in no time (if you subtract the time it took me to figure out how to get them all batch selected and then converted.

HDR - I was also excited to see that HDR is built in. I have long played with Photomatix's trial version but have been afraid to pull the trigger. Also, I have used the Photoshop plug in and this built in option is more like the plug in and less dynamic than Photomatix. Or at least with my current abilities. I can get it to make decent HDR images again testing with Alaskan images of glaciers, but I cannot get that unworldly look. Not sure if that is me, or not in the abilities of this software. But I was able to get highlights on the ice as well as details in underbrush so that is success.

Other things - It does look like there is a learning curve and I am still early in the process. I have many photos from over the years and hope to shoot some to start populating catalogs and seeing how this affects my work flow. I'm looking forward to trying more batch corrections and occasional clean up with the editing tools. From my brief playing, stuff like red eyes and little flaws in image or exposure are fairly quick to fix. I like the base tools on the right and it works as well if not faster than photoshop for me. Looking forward to additional exploration including Meta data etc.
history.review_title: Seems like a good intro to studio workflow.

product.title: Corel AfterShot Pro 3 | RAW Photo Editing Software [PC Download]

history.review_excerpt:
But I have to admit that it all went pretty smoothly and I was completely done in about two hours.

Some Caveats, my taxes are pretty easy and I cannot itemize beyond the standard deduction, so my taxes are very straight forward. To get my state taxes filed took two more additional costs which brought the total with the purchase price of the software to over $100. I paid the additional costs for state and state filing for convenience, but it hurt each time that it said "enter your payment information." Again, I knew that the state was not included so I can't complain, but I would love to find a solution that says, "here is your total cost" and clearly shows what is included.
history.review_full:
We have been using HandR Block software, then HandR Block online forever and I have been getting tired of the hidden costs that seem to increase each year. So this year when I got a chance to get a free reviewer copy of TurboTax Fed and Efile from Amazon Vine, I jumped at the chance to make the change. It was a little disappointing to not be able to find a way to import last years information from HandRblock.com, but that is probably due to HandR block, or my inability to find a export option. So I sat down expecting to have to trudge through re-entering all my data. But I have to admit that it all went pretty smoothly and I was completely done in about two hours.

Some Caveats, my taxes are pretty easy and I cannot itemize beyond the standard deduction, so my taxes are very straight forward. However, I was impressed with the thoroughness of the of the interview questions and clarity of questions. I was never confused about what to put where or whether I qualified for something. All in all, it was a nice, non frustrating experience.

My biggest beef with this is that, like HandR, there are fees beyond paying for the box. This only included the Fed and its filing. To get my state taxes filed took two more additional costs which brought the total with the purchase price of the software to over $100. I paid the additional costs for state and state filing for convenience, but it hurt each time that it said "enter your payment information." Again, I knew that the state was not included so I can't complain, but I would love to find a solution that says, "here is your total cost" and clearly shows what is included.
history.review_title: Nice Easy Interview Process, For my Basic Taxes it is perfect

product.title: TurboTax Basic Tax Software 2017 Fed + Efile PC/MAC Disc

history.review_excerpt:
I have been trying to learn Spanish with a couple high school years from 30 some years ago, Duolingo, and by reading a number of Spanish language books like Harry Potter, The Lion The Witch and the wardrobe. They are brief but seem to stick.

The bad things I found was that it gets a little repetitive and grows a little tiring. With Babbel I find there are some words and phrases it will just not recognize, but this actually focuses me on pronunciation, so this might be good, if a little frustrating. But this is a fantastic supplement to Duolingo, and a combination and going back and forth might keep things fresh.
history.review_full:
I have been trying to learn Spanish with a couple high school years from 30 some years ago, Duolingo, and by reading a number of Spanish language books like Harry Potter, The Lion The Witch and the wardrobe. When I got a chance to get a reviewer subscription to Babbel.com I jumped at it.

Initially, I kind of didn't like Babbel. It seemed a little clumsy. You need to do a lot of typing, which doesn't work well on my iPhone and was somewhat frustrating on my ipad as the window jumped around when the keyboard came up. But when I pulled it up on my touch screen laptop, it really worked fairly well. And, once I got over the "inconvenience" of having to type in Spanish words (something Duolingo seems to have limited,) I found that it really helped me to focus on gender and spellings. It actually became a very good teaching tool, although it took a little familiarity. You are prompted with lettered buttons that show the letters in the word, which seems like a little too much for a cue.

I really liked a number of things that helped my learning. First, it features a different word set than duolingo, even for the same objects. I like that I got a different vocabulary. I also liked that they would put the beginner words into sentences that were unapologetically complex. It was nice to have more challenging sentences than could be made with the beginner words and when I sampled intermediate and advanced levels, I found that Advanced is an immersion experience that I really like. Lastly, I think that Babbel does a better job of giving helpful rules for Spanish. They are brief but seem to stick.

The bad things I found was that it gets a little repetitive and grows a little tiring. One of the beginner features is speech recognition which is not working well for me. Duolingo speech recognition seems a little more tolerant. With Babbel I find there are some words and phrases it will just not recognize, but this actually focuses me on pronunciation, so this might be good, if a little frustrating. Definitely use a headset as built in microphones definitely don't work as well.

All in all, a good resource with its pros and cons. It might be in line with duolingo which has the advantage of being free. But this is a fantastic supplement to Duolingo, and a combination and going back and forth might keep things fresh.
history.review_title: A Good Alternative or Supplement to Duolingo or Rosetta Stone

product.title: Babbel: Learn Languages - 6 Months Subscription on iOS, Android, Mac, PC - mobile app & online

history.review_full: So, I am 43 years old and I have so much fun playing this game with my 11 year old daughter.  It is a fun little workout and definitely gets you off the couch and moving.  My daughter has the Just Dance Wii, Just Dance XBOX 360, Dance Central XBOX 360, and all the Zumba dance games for the Wii and XBOX 360.  She said this is her favorite out of all of the ones she owns.  Most of the music is really catchy.  She said said she likes about 80% of the music and dances.  For an "old" mom like me, I like about 50% of the music and dances.  Of course, my daughter plays it in a much harder mode and loves it.  She said even the advanced mode is a bit too difficult for her and she has been part of a dance company for 8 years.  I like the easy mode, as that seems to be hard enough for me. It seems to pick up your moves accurately, so I think the Kinect works well, unlike some of the Kinect games we have.  So, I would highly recommend it... a lot of fun... very challenging... and a good, get off the couch, workout.
history.review_title: For and old Mom like me, this is a lot of fun!

PROS

Very easy to pair to any Bluetooth capable device

Not just great for gaming... they are great all around headphones
Lightweight, so it's not an issue to wear them for a long period
Earpieces fold in so the become flat for storage
Zipper case is compact and makes them easy to store
Battery life is really great

CONS
I wish it had a little more bass to the sound
The price is a bit steep, but still... they are great headphones
Wish I could pair to more than one device at a time (for example... iPhone for incoming calls and a gaming system at the same time)

Overall... I would highly recommend them. They are a great set of headphones.

history.review_excerpt: I have to start by saying that we are not hard core gamers in our family, but we do enjoy playing our Wii and XBOX 360. My 13 year old daughter got a little frustrated getting through the first couple levels because it kept starting her over in spots because she would not complete the task fast enough. Now, with that said, one of her hard core gaming friends came over and played it and he had finished all levels within a few days only coming over for a couple hours at a time. So, I could see how some hard core gamers might get a bit frustrated with it because of how short it is. The profanity is probably less than a child would experience in a school hallway so I wasn't to bothered by it.
history.review_full: I have to start by saying that we are not hard core gamers in our family, but we do enjoy playing our Wii and XBOX 360.  We found this game to be really fun.  It is not high stress like a game such as Titan Fall, but it is more of a thought game with timed events.  My 13 year old daughter got a little frustrated getting through the first couple levels because it kept starting her over in spots because she would not complete the task fast enough.  But, eventually she figured it out and was having a lot of fun with it.  Now, with that said, one of her hard core gaming friends came over and played it and he had finished all levels within a few days only coming over for a couple hours at a time.  So, I could see how some hard core gamers might get a bit frustrated with it because of how short it is.  We found it to be a lot of fun and just right for our family and I would definitely recommend.  As a parent, just be aware that there is some profanity and violence.  The profanity is probably less than a child would experience in a school hallway so I wasn't to bothered by it.

history.review_excerpt:
The different gangs each had a unique quirk that allowed for quite a bit of individuality in play and planning.

This is a nice upgrade, adding more streamlined rules and simplifying the character stats.

If you are intrigued by the Warhammer 40K universe this is a way to get introduced, but understand that this is not the same rule set. Its similar but this game uses an individual movement system rather than the squad based movement and fighting of the larger game.

I really enjoy this game, it allows a lot of individuality. It does have some issues with balance in long campaigns as luck with gang members surviving fights can contribute into some gangs being far more powerful than others, but its always a challenging puzzle.
history.review_full:
I had copies of the original version of Necromunda. It was a great game that required solid tactical planning. The different gangs each had a unique quirk that allowed for quite a bit of individuality in play and planning.

This is a nice upgrade, adding more streamlined rules and simplifying the character stats.

If you are intrigued by the Warhammer 40K universe this is a way to get introduced, but understand that this is not the same rule set. Its similar but this game uses an individual movement system rather than the squad based movement and fighting of the larger game.

I really enjoy this game, it allows a lot of individuality. It does have some issues with balance in long campaigns as luck with gang members surviving fights can contribute into some gangs being far more powerful than others, but its always a challenging puzzle.

history.review_full:
SO at first I hated this, the caps key, letter A, and another were sticking like crazy when I pressed them! I found out what it was... If this happens, look down and you'll see the edges of those keys have some excess plastic hanging out, just pop the key caps off and use a knife to trim the extra plastic off. Now my keyboard works perfectly. It looks nice and the lights are really cool. Mouse works well, all buttons and scroll wheel work perfectly.

I don't think I'll keep this keyboard though, I didn't realize it doesn't even have the arrow keys to the right. I honestly wish this keyboard was just a few keys wider as it's difficult for me to use in my lap. I imagine it'd be easier to use on a desk but I needed a keyboard to keep by the bed and use on my computer there so I can sit in bed and surf the internet. This keyboard is just a tad too small and I miss my 10 key and arrows. I don't count that against my ratings though- I just didn't know how much I'd miss these things until they were no longer on the keyboard. You can use the letter keys to arrow up, down, and sideways but I can't figure out how to make that work no matter what key combination I use.

heldout.review_full:
High quality look and feel with this controller. Really wanted to love it, but can't. It has a ton of really awesome features, but the instructions were translated to English so badly, I can't figure out how to use a single feature this has. The X, A, B and Y buttons are the wrong colors, which you don't know 'til you get it, as the pictures they show those buttons as grey. It has a faceplate you can swap out, but nowhere can you buy other faceplates, so why list it as a feature? The worst, the controller has very little control. If say, I want to turn my character left, on other game pads, I can turn them slowly left, or quickly left, based on how far I press the joystick. On this one though, it is hard to turn my character slowly left, and aiming is crazy hard because of that.

This is subjective; but this thing is tiny, clearly for kids or people with small hands. I can use it, but am constantly hitting many buttons at once. Perfectly fine for kids and those with small hands though. The battery life is decent, and the vibration is also decent.

history.review_excerpt: Really makes a difference on Forza Motorsport 7 and Forza Horizon 3. If you plan to install more than a couple of 4K games, get an external USB 3.0/3.1 drive. It would almost make sense for Microsoft to sell these with a smaller drive installed, but smaller than 1TB isn't cheaper anyway. It requires separate drives for each purpose, storage and media. For storage, let the XBox One format it. For media, format it as NTFS using a PC. Once a game is installed on the external drive, it can be played on any other XBox One. All video formats will be available, whatever the machine supports. It makes a decent heater for a small room also.

history.review_excerpt:
As a kid I remember playing Pokémon Red on my Game Boy and Pokemon Yellow on my Game Boy Color and have so many fond memories of it.

Now, as a 31 year old man, I bought this game with my Switch to try to relive some of those moments and enjoy the nostalgia.

I haven’t played any Pokémon games since Pokemon Yellow so playing this game was a real treat!

This game was really fun! I didn’t even bother looking for more powerful Pokémon because the first 6 I got were fine and able to beat anyone I came across.

Having said that, this game is great for children! It’s not too hard where they’ll get frustrated, but it’s not too easy for children either.
history.review_full:
As a kid I remember playing Pokémon Red on my Game Boy and Pokemon Yellow on my Game Boy Color and have so many fond memories of it.

Now, as a 31 year old man, I bought this game with my Switch to try to relive some of those moments and enjoy the nostalgia.

I haven’t played any Pokémon games since Pokemon Yellow so playing this game was a real treat!

This game was really fun! I don’t regret buying it. But having said that it does have some flaws. Firstly: This Pokémon game was ALOT easier than the older Red, Blue and Yellow ones. I was able to collect all 8 badges in 10 hours of playtime, a lot of that time I wasn’t even playing and just left the game on and a lot more of it was spent in the constant cut scenes. It seems like just when I feel like I’m really getting going Sonia, or especially, Hop interfere and want to have long conversations or, for Hop, to duel me. It’s pretty annoying. Not only that but the fights are much easier. I got through every gym and got all 8 badges without losing a single battle. I didn’t even bother looking for more powerful Pokémon because the first 6 I got were fine and able to beat anyone I came across.

Having said that, this game is great for children! It’s not too hard where they’ll get frustrated, but it’s not too easy for children either. Each gym battle (except one) is fought in a huge arena and it feels great to hear the crowd cheering you on. The music is upbeat and really got me in the mood to kick butt. Each badge earned comes with a sense of accomplishment which is great.

All in all I do recommend this game for children or for adults who played the older games and just want some nostalgia.
history.review_title: A lovely little piece of nostalgia!

product.title: Pokémon Sword + Pokémon Sword Expansion Pass - Nintendo Switch

history.review_excerpt:
Obviously I prefer my PC but it’s nice to be able to play games like Witcher 3 and then when I have to go somewhere in the car or something I can seamlessly “Switch” to the Switch and continue my game.

There are some absolutely AMAZING games on the Switch: Zelda: Breath of the Wild, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe, Witcher 3, Splatoon, Super Smash Ultimate, etc., which are worth buying the Switch. It’s a great console for anyone who just wants to have a good time and it’s especially great for families or people with young kids who want to play games with them without worrying about violence, drug use, sexual situations, etc., that are in a lot of other games.

5/5 Stars
history.review_full:
I bought the Switch a few months ago and now that I’ve spent some time with it (more than I’d like to admit ^_^) I wanted to leave a review.

The Switch has many pros over other consoles, it’s main pro being that it’s a portable console with games that previously are only found on PC or console. I am a PC gamer and my PC is an absolute beast with an 8700K & 2080 Ti BUT the reason I bought a Switch is because oftentimes I am out and about and can’t bring my big honkin’ PC with me. Obviously I prefer my PC but it’s nice to be able to play games like Witcher 3 and then when I have to go somewhere in the car or something I can seamlessly “Switch” to the Switch and continue my game.

There are some absolutely AMAZING games on the Switch: Zelda: Breath of the Wild, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe, Witcher 3, Splatoon, Super Smash Ultimate, etc., which are worth buying the Switch. This is especially true for people with kids as most of Nintendo’s big hits are kid friendly. You may not want your very young children to play violent games like Call of Duty or Battlefield 5 but they can definitely play a similar kind of game with Splatoon 2 only instead of shooting bullets to kill people they’re splattering paint all over each other.

However the Switch also has its cons. Let’s start with Nintendo’s “E-Shop”. The E-shop sells games that are WAY overpriced. They charge $59.99 USD for games that have been out for years. The fact is you can buy physical copies of these games for less on Amazon AND you have the benefit of being able to resell the game later if you want too. Not so with digital games.

Then there is the price. Yes the Switch is $299 which is cheaper than Microsoft and Sony’s consoles but when you factor in the cost of necessities that are almost required for optimal play (Pro Controller, SD card, Screen Protector) the cost adds up quickly.

All in all though I do recommend the Nintendo Switch. It’s a great console for anyone who just wants to have a good time and it’s especially great for families or people with young kids who want to play games with them without worrying about violence, drug use, sexual situations, etc., that are in a lot of other games.

5/5 Stars
history.review_title: It has its pros & cons..but more pros!

Once I found that and turned it off the issue was gone.

Please ignore my negative comment below.

I bought this controller in January 2020 and up until the last week or so (August 2020) it was working great and I absolutely loved it. I tried recalibrating the stick in the Nintendo Switch settings and it would fix it for about 30 seconds before it started drifting again.

This issue is particularly noticeable in games like Mario Kart 8 Deluxe where my racer will start drifting to the left which makes racing almost impossible since I can’t control my own car drifting while racing.

Sadly my warranty expired and I’m really annoyed that I paid so much only for it to break in less than a year.
heldout.review_full:
Update 8/31/20: Upgrading back to 5/5 stars! Turns out I accidentally turned motion control on without knowing it. Once I found that and turned it off the issue was gone.

Please ignore my negative comment below.

I bought this controller in January 2020 and up until the last week or so (August 2020) it was working great and I absolutely loved it. I was totally fine with paying what I did and would’ve happily done so again.

Unfortunately around last week my controller started having an issue where the left analog stick was drifting the the left and nothing could fix it. I tried recalibrating the stick in the Nintendo Switch settings and it would fix it for about 30 seconds before it started drifting again.

This issue is particularly noticeable in games like Mario Kart 8 Deluxe where my racer will start drifting to the left which makes racing almost impossible since I can’t control my own car drifting while racing.

Sadly my warranty expired and I’m really annoyed that I paid so much only for it to break in less than a year. I take good care of it and always wash my hands before playing so it’s not an issue of poor treatment of the controller.

I hope other people don’t have this issue but felt I should mention it since it happened to me.
heldout.review_title: Great for the first year..then drifting issues.

Although I like all the bells & whistles of the more expensive name brand gaming mice, it makes me cringe when I have to replace them so quickly. I was cautiously optimistic over trying a brand that I am unfamiliar with and have been pleasantly surprised. It has many of the features I like from other brands I've tried, Logitech & Razer to name a couple, but for a price that won't bother me if I have to replace it in 2 years. The mouse is very responsive, no issues when playing my favorite computer games. It's super comfortable, very little hand fatigue after playing for a long time.
history.review_full: I must be brutal with my computer mouse since I tend to have to replace them every 2 years or so. The left and right click buttons begin to fail and become unresponsive. I was cautiously optimistic over trying a brand that I am unfamiliar with and have been pleasantly surprised. It has many of the features I like from other brands I've tried, Logitech & Razer to name a couple, but for a price that won't bother me if I have to replace it in 2 years. history.review_excerpt: My sons love gaming! They have the Xbox 360, the PS5 (one son has a digital version, the other has a disc version) and I recently purchased the Oculus VR for my husband as his Christmas gift. [I really hope he doesn’t read this review.] With my “gamers” in mind, I thought this would be a nice accessory them. I have noticed, when I do venture into either of my son’s room, their PS5s seem to give off a little heat! This device (by Heatfun Store) is perfect and has multiple uses. It is easy to assemble. The fan is pretty quiet and has 3 settings (low, medium and high). You can store up to 12 games/DVDs beside it and charge your controllers. Overall, he is extremely satisfied and gives it 5 stars.
history.review_full: My sons love gaming! Both of them and they are in their early 20s. They have the Xbox 360, the PS5 (one son has a digital version, the other has a disc version) and I recently purchased the Oculus VR for my husband as his Christmas gift.  [I really hope he doesn’t read this review.] With my “gamers” in mind, I thought this would be a nice accessory them. I have noticed, when I do venture into either of my son’s room, their PS5s seem to give off a little heat! This device (by Heatfun Store) is perfect and has multiple uses. You can organize, charge and cool. The stand allows you to keep your device vertically while cooling with a fan! It is easy to assemble. The fan is pretty quiet and has 3 settings (low, medium and high). You can store up to 12 games/DVDs beside it and charge your controllers. Overall, he is extremely satisfied and gives it 5 stars.  **Note: I am going to have to order enough for my other son.

history.review_excerpt:
My husband and I were at a friend’s house (a few months ago) who owns a Meta Quest 2. So, I decided this device would be the perfect gift for him, for Christmas. He seems to be really enjoying it and so do other members of the family!

The set-up is simple. You can even travel to different countries (which is cool), go on a safari,
mountain climb, play golf and so many other activities. The graphics are great and offers you a realistic view (360 degrees) of whatever you are looking at. The set comes with the headset, 2 controllers, and a storage bag/cover. Overall, while a little pricey, I think it is worth it (especially for a man who has everything).
history.review_full:
My husband and I were at a friend’s house (a few months ago) who owns a Meta Quest 2. He invited us to play and I noticed how much my husband enjoyed it. So, I decided this device would be the perfect gift for him, for Christmas. He seems to be really enjoying it and so do other members of the family!

The set-up is simple. Once connected you are ready to begin downloading games. Some are free and some aren’t. You can even travel to different countries (which is cool), go on a safari,
mountain climb, play golf and so many other activities. There are informative and interactive videos. The graphics are great and offers you a realistic view (360 degrees) of whatever you are looking at. There are also chat rooms (if you are interested in that type of thing), interactive and multi-player games (like Saber), and much more. Some of these games (like Saber) improve hand/eye coordination. It can be a family friendly game/environment. The set comes with the headset, 2 controllers, and a storage bag/cover. It is lightweight and portable. It even comes with an adaptor for eyeglass wearers. Overall, while a little pricey, I think it is worth it (especially for a man who has everything).

history.review_excerpt:
I anticipated he’d find something to complain about- So, Imagine my surprise when he didn’t!

Worn over the crown with a ratchet mechanism this truly does create a personalized fit.. This is more then adequate for a larger size head with even room to spare- and my son has an unusually larger head (so yes!! It will fit an adult as well.) Best of all, bc of hollow cut out design and materials used- this is beyond lightweight which is so helpful!! But, he does expect high quality and clear ability to hear teammates voices while gaming over everything else.. (I mention bc, it happened to us!)
For a $30 price point this is a solid headset we use on the PS4 system.
history.review_full:
Ordered for my son who’s both particular and a bit hard on equipment.. The FANTECH headset passed the test which says a lot coming from one of the tougher critics- a Teenager!! I anticipated he’d find something to complain about- So, Imagine my surprise when he didn’t!

Worn over the crown with a ratchet mechanism this truly does create a personalized fit.. This is more then adequate for a larger size head with even room to spare- and my son has an unusually larger head (so yes!! It will fit an adult as well.) Best of all, bc of hollow cut out design and materials used- this is beyond lightweight which is so helpful!! This doesn’t a sore neck/back due to heaviness after wearing for a longer length of time.

Ear pieces are large enough to encompass the entire inner ear and with almost 1” of “moldable foam” to act like a sealant.. it shuts out the outside noises while being comfortable as it’s worn. The sound is solid.. For my son he’s not a stickler for the perfect iconic surround sound in a gaming headset. But, he does expect high quality and clear ability to hear teammates voices while gaming over everything else.. and so far, this sound quality hasn’t let him down! Removable mic. Is a perk if not playing with a team.. it helps keep it safe/out of way when not in use!

This has a solid but nicely bendable cord to connect into gaming controller.. it provides plenty of slack so user does not feel as if placed on a tight leash! Connections stay strong and in place with no loose fit.. and if sound does fail, don’t forget it may be inside the controller! (I mention bc, it happened to us!)
For a $30 price point this is a solid headset we use on the PS4 system. This has provided comfort and quality for a decent price. Hoping this info can help your decision- stay safe!

history.review_full:
With a PS4 and the discontinued Sony controllers for the system (or sheer lack of ability to produce- I’ve heard both issues?!)… either way it has gamers scrambling for alternatives! For half the price- this provides a working alternative.. for my gaming son, he rates this a solid B!

Everything it does is adequate and above. He said there’s no drift which is huge- however.. some of the responses can be a fraction of a second slow and if playing on a team competitively he hates being the weakest link. If the alternative is not playing at all- he’s more than happy to make it work for him! Of course if he had his wishes… He’d choose gaming brand!! He tells me there is most definitely a difference… (for what it’s worth!)

One other mention was the nice fit/feel in the hand.. not light weight nor heavy. It has substance with an ergonomic grip to make button use, commands and joystick easy to access…

This is a solid plan B… and in a quirky place to deal with supply/demand at least this is an option at $32 vs. $64 it’s exactly 1/2. For a gamer that it’s hard on his controllers like mine.. it seems this is where frustration gets taken out in the game (hmm?!) Im grateful OUBANG provides B level capabilities. Hoping info can help make your decision- stay safe everyone.

Following instructions we were sadly disappointed.. we had ZERO success pairing to our PS4 game system and never even made a connection. we got nada!!

Researching google, YouTube and any written info possible.. So, defect was not specific to just our device. I must add some buyers had no complaints and success using their controller- making this a “hit or miss” type gamble on the outcome.

I would suggest If you do choose to order this PS4 controller.. it is in your best interest to connect immediately upon arrival- In case of any failure.. Hoping info can help make your decision.. stay safe everyone.
history.review_full:
It pains me to say… PS4 controller left us dead in the water from the start! Following instructions we were sadly disappointed.. we had ZERO success pairing to our PS4 game system and never even made a connection. To be certain it wasn’t user error on our part- we had a 3rd party try.. results were the same.. we got nada!!

Researching google, YouTube and any written info possible.. we found others who’d experienced the same results as us.. So, defect was not specific to just our device. I must add some buyers had no complaints and success using their controller- making this a “hit or miss” type gamble on the outcome.

I would suggest If you do choose to order this PS4 controller.. it is in your best interest to connect immediately upon arrival- In case of any failure.. it can be rectified in appropriate time frame. Hoping info can help make your decision.. stay safe everyone.
history.review_title: Dead from the start- would NOT even pair to PS4…!!

history.review_excerpt:
Unique idea that draws players in… no heavy instructions to explain or comprehend (huge perk when not all pay attn.!) Basically x4 categories: draw a card- spell an answer with tiles.. tbh, our is so faint. (but, with new game you shouldn’t have too.) Bottle base has own built in threads to hold cards but, not exactly straight its gets off track and jams! So aside from quirky container- game is quite fun!!

Total truth: we tossed out the categories- it was far easier and included younger people. rhyming was fun (but the others.. see, adaptable!

A higher price for the few flaws yet, we had fun!! Played with grade school/preteens (*use phonetic rules if spelling is too tough) and adjust categories.
history.review_full:
Unique idea that draws players in… no heavy instructions to explain or comprehend (huge perk when not all pay attn.!) Basically x4 categories: draw a card- spell an answer with tiles.. first to complete and hit buzzer wins round. That’s it-

Bottle design is fun.. just not practical. Buzzer gets stuck if not inserted exactly straight and exposed it can “compress” to death. tbh, our is so faint. I think it happened. *Note: you can use generic buzzer/bell if this fails.. (but, with new game you shouldn’t have too.) Bottle base has own built in threads to hold cards but, not exactly straight its gets off track and jams! So aside from quirky container- game is quite fun!!

Total truth: we tossed out the categories- it was far easier and included younger people. You can make up our own.. ie, answer must reference a family member, pick a color associated with the word etc. rhyming was fun (but the others.. ehh!) *Just know- game is adaptable!! **Hack: You can also add letter tiles from another banana gram game to allow more words or players.. see, adaptable!

A higher price for the few flaws yet, we had fun!! Played with grade school/preteens (*use phonetic rules if spelling is too tough) and adjust categories. Played with college kids and they ran with this! Some things to consider first- Who is your audience? Are you an adaptable game crew…??! Hoping info helps decision- stay safe everyone.
history.review_title: Clever bottle holder- not practical.. older crew had more fun!! Adaptable..

heldout.review_excerpt:
With a teen who’s tough and unforgiving on controllers- “bc, that IS actually a thing..” I’ve been told- gamers get aggressive and even wear out buttons and such to stay alive. I’ve also found higher $$$ does not always equate to durable or longevity!! I’d rather just a solid build and ergonomic fit in the hand- and this met our requirements!

Built with a different body shape than the standard PS4 controller- it still has a nice reach for button control. but, it’s just an aesthetic feature. Ha ha… obviously won’t Improve your game skills but, a nice identifier if playing with group- very unique.

Connection to charge is snug..and this matters so, if plugged in overnite -it’s game ready the next day. So far, so good- makes a great gift for a PS4 enthusiast!
heldout.review_full:
With a teen who’s tough and unforgiving on controllers- “bc, that IS actually a thing..” I’ve been told- gamers get aggressive and even wear out buttons and such to stay alive. Hmm.. just trying to wrap my mind around the fact.. he does realize this is only simulated war survival?! Ha!

Choosing a replacement controller: I try for a happy, medium.. cheaper versions seem to have connectability issues and/or stops functioning for no reason- wasting $! I’ve also found higher $$$ does not always equate to durable or longevity!! Not interested in extra whistles/bells.. I’d rather just a solid build and ergonomic fit in the hand- and this met our requirements!

Built with a different body shape than the standard PS4 controller- it still has a nice reach for button control. Flippers feel substantial with expected response time. Paint/wrap is cool.. but, it’s just an aesthetic feature. Ha ha… obviously won’t Improve your game skills but, a nice identifier if playing with group- very unique.

Connection to charge is snug..and this matters so, if plugged in overnite -it’s game ready the next day. Rumble pack, sound, blinking lights- are extra bling features that don’t affect gaming.. this has what it needs where it matters most.

Used x10 days daily by one who’s “life depends on it..” as we have established!! So far, so good- makes a great gift for a PS4 enthusiast! Hoping info helps decision.. stay safe everyone.
heldout.review_title: Unique look and shape- good button reach and response.. impressed!!!

history.review_excerpt:
Many Nintendo Switch cases have hit the market since the release of the versatile gaming system and this this one meets all of the critical criteria of a good case but falls a bit short in order to be considered great.

The Switch fits perfectly in the top with adequate padding to protect the critical top glass LED screen. Often when the Nintendo Switch is played in handheld mode the joycons are held separately from the central screen unit so the fact that they don’t fit on it in the case does not matter.

In his opinion this is the best case he has used for his Nintendo Switch and we would definitely recommend it as a great way to protect your investment.
history.review_full:
Many Nintendo Switch cases have hit the market since the release of the versatile gaming system and this this one meets all of the critical criteria of a good case but falls a bit short in order to be considered great.

The Switch fits perfectly in the top with adequate padding to protect the critical top glass LED screen. The 2 Joy-Con controllers fit snugly into individual slots beneath the main unit and there is another secure area to store the power adapter (and a few games) which is a huge plus for this case - which many other cases neglect.

As I stated, for travel purposes, this case is excellent.

While this case advertises itself as one where you can “charge and play” - that is awkward at best. First the Joy-Cons do not comfortably fit on the primary unit while in the case. If too much pressure is applied to the screen while propped on the stand it moves too much for accurate game play.

I have to give this case 3 STARS - it will definitely protect your Nintendo Switch and all of its necessary accessories when traveling better than many other cases but it won’t be staying in the case as you play...

UPDATE TO ORIGINAL REVIEW: Now that my son has had more time using this case he has told me that he liked it much more than he initially did.

Since I do not actually use the Switch I had to write my review based on his impressions and as he has used it he has liked it more and more. Often when the Nintendo Switch is played in handheld mode the joycons are held separately from the central screen unit so the fact that they don’t fit on it in the case does not matter.

In his opinion this is the best case he has used for his Nintendo Switch and we would definitely recommend it as a great way to protect your investment.
history.review_title: Decent HARD case for travel - charging a bit of a trick when in case.
